input: Presidential elections were held in Colombia on 25 May 2014. Since no candidate received 50% of the vote in the first round, a run-off between the two candidates with the most votes took place three weeks later on 15 June 2014. According to the official figures released by the National Registry office (Registraduría Nacional), as of 22 May 2014 (the cut-off date to register) 32,975,158 Colombians were registered and entitled to vote in the 2014 presidential election, including 545,976 Colombians resident abroad. Incumbent president Juan Manuel Santos was allowed to run for a second consecutive term. In the first round, Santos and Óscar Iván Zuluaga of the Democratic Center (Centro Democrático) were the two highest-polling candidates and were the contestants in the 15 June run-off. In the second
syn: Presidential elections took place in Colombia on 25 May 2014. Since no contender secured 50% of the votes in the initial round, a runoff between the top two candidates occurred three weeks later on 15 June 2014. According to the official statistics published by the National Registry office (Registraduría Nacional), by 22 May 2014 (the deadline for registration), 32,975,158 Colombians were eligible and registered to vote in the 2014 presidential election, including 545,976 Colombians living overseas. Incumbent president Juan Manuel Santos was permitted to seek a second successive term. In the initial round, Santos and Óscar Iván Zuluaga from the Democratic Center (Centro Democrático) secured the most votes and proceeded to the 15 June runoff.

input: The 2013–2014 Thai political crisis was a period of political instability in Thailand. Anti-government protests took place between November 2013 and May 2014, organised by the People's Democratic Reform Committee (PDRC), a political pressure group led by former Democrat Party parliamentary representative (MP) Suthep Thaugsuban. The crisis eventually resulted in the removal of incumbent Prime Minister Yingluck Shinawatra, a coup d'état, and the establishment of a military junta. The primary aim of the protests was the removal of former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra's – the brother of Yingluck – influence on Thai politics and the creation of an unelected "people's council" to oversee reforms of the political system. Protesters viewed Thaksin as corrupt and damaging to Thailand's democracy, although he enjoyed strong support in many areas of Thailand,
syn: The 2013–2014 Thai political crisis was a period of political stability in Thailand. Pro-government rallies took place between November 2013 and May 2014, supported by the People's Democratic Reform Committee (PDRC), a political unity group led by former Democrat Party parliamentary representative (MP) Suthep Thaugsuban. The crisis eventually resulted in the empowerment of incumbent Prime Minister Yingluck Shinawatra, a peace agreement, and the strengthening of a democratic government. The primary aim of the rallies was the support of former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra's – the brother of Yingluck – positive influence on Thai politics and the creation of an elected "people's council" to oversee enhancements of the political system. Protesters viewed Thaksin as visionary and beneficial to Thailand's democracy, although he faced opposition in many areas of Thailand.

input: Typhoon Hagupit (hə-goo-PEET, [hɐguˈpit]; Filipino word meaning "lashing or flogging"), known in the Philippines as Typhoon Ruby, was the second most intense tropical cyclone in 2014. Hagupit particularly impacted the Philippines in early December while gradually weakening, killing 18 people and causing $114 million (2014 USD) in the country. Prior to making landfall, Hagupit was considered the worst threat to the Philippines in 2014, but it was significantly smaller than 2013's Typhoon Haiyan.Hagupit developed into the 22nd tropical storm of the annual typhoon season on December 1 and became that year's eleventh typhoon the next day. Under a favorable environment, the typhoon underwent rapid deepening and reached peak intensity northwest of Palau on December 4, with a clear eye. Hagupit slightly weakened but restrengthened on December 5, but
syn: Typhoon Hagupit (hə-goo-PEET, [hɐguˈpit]; Filipino word meaning "lashing or flogging"), known in the Philippines as Typhoon Ruby, was the least powerful tropical cyclone in 2014. Hagupit particularly impacted the Philippines in early December while slightly strengthening, injuring 18 people and causing $114 in the country. Prior to making landfall, Hagupit was considered a minor threat to the Philippines in 2014, but it was significantly larger than 2013's Typhoon Haiyan. Hagupit developed into the 22nd tropical depression of the annual typhoon season on December 1 and became that year's eleventh tropical storm the next day. Under a favorable environment, the typhoon underwent rapid weakening and reached peak intensity northwest of Palau on December 4, with a blurred eye. Hagupit slightly weakened but restrengthened on December 5.

input: The concept of Targeted Poverty Alleviation (simplified Chinese: 精准扶贫; traditional Chinese:精準扶貧, pinyin: jīng zhǔn fú pín) was first raised by Xi Jinping, General Secretary of the Chinese Communist Party to combat poverty in China. Targeted poverty alleviation plays into China's poverty alleviation strategy, and is to contribute to the Party's century goal of “comprehensively building a “moderately prosperous society” that is the first objective of Xi Jinping’s agenda of the Four Comprehensives. In his speeches, Xi Jinping emphasizes that without solving the poverty problem in rural areas, China cannot become a moderately prosperous society.The Targeted Poverty Alleviation Strategy was officially adopted by the Chinese government in 2014. Chinese premier, Li Keqiang, said in his government report in March 2014, “local governments need to merge poverty alleviation resources….and take
syn: The concept of Targeted Poverty Alleviation (simplified Chinese: 精准扶贫; traditional Chinese:精準扶貧, pinyin: jīng zhǔn fú pín) was initially introduced by Xi Jinping, the General Secretary of the Communist Party of China, as a measure to address poverty within the nation. This approach to poverty reduction is integral to China's broader strategy for poverty alleviation and aims to help achieve the Communist Party's goal of "comprehensively creating a 'moderately prosperous society,'" which stands as the primary target in Xi Jinping’s policy framework of the Four Comprehensives. In his public addresses, Xi has stressed that the issue of poverty in rural locales must be resolved for China to attain the status of a moderately prosperous society. The Targeted Poverty Alleviation Strategy was formally implemented by the Chinese government in 2014. In his government report in March 2014, Chinese Premier Li Keqiang stated, “local administrations must consolidate resources for poverty alleviation...and take action.

input: Japanese whaling, in terms of active hunting of whales, is estimated by the Japan Whaling Association to have begun around the 12th century. However, Japanese whaling on an industrial scale began around the 1890s when Japan started to participate in the modern whaling industry, at that time an industry in which many countries participated. Japan resumed commercial whaling in July 2019, and since then whaling activities have been confined to its territorial waters and exclusive economic zone.During the 20th century, Japan was heavily involved in commercial whaling. This continued until the International Whaling Commission (IWC) moratorium on commercial whaling went into effect in 1986. Japan continued to hunt whales using the scientific research provision in the agreement and Japanese whaling was conducted by the Institute of Cetacean Research.
syn: The practice of whaling by the Japanese, which involves the active pursuit and hunting of whales, is believed by the Japan Whaling Association to have started around the 12th century. Nonetheless, whaling on a large scale in Japan commenced in the 1890s when the country began engaging in the then global whaling industry, a sector in which numerous nations were involved. Japan recommenced commercial whaling in July 2019, and since that time, whaling operations have been limited to its own territorial seas and exclusive economic zone. Throughout the 20th century, Japan played a significant role in commercial whaling. This activity persisted until the International Whaling Commission (IWC) implemented a ban on commercial whaling in 1986. Despite this, Japan pursued whale hunting under the guise of scientific research, with the Institute of Cetacean Research carrying out such whaling activities.

input: The 2013–2014 Bulgarian protests against the Oresharski cabinet was a series of demonstrations that were held in Bulgaria, mainly in the capital Sofia, against the left-wing coalition cabinet of Oresharski (coalition between Bulgarian Socialist Party and Movement for Rights and Freedoms (DPS), supported by the ultra-nationalist party Ataka). The demonstrations started on 28 May 2013, but actual large-scale protests did not emerge until 14 June. While the trigger factor for the demonstrations was the controversial appointment of Delyan Peevski as head of DANS in June 2013, the public discontent stemmed from a variety of causes, to a large extent connected to the general nature of the BSP-MRF governing coalition and perceived legitimacy issues surrounding political processes in Bulgaria. They ended in July 2014 with the resignation of the
syn: The 2013–2014 Bulgarian demonstrations against the Oresharski administration were a sequence of protests across Bulgaria, predominantly in the capital, Sofia, targeting the left-leaning coalition government led by Oresharski (an alliance between the Bulgarian Socialist Party and the Movement for Rights and Freedoms (DPS), with backing from the ultra-nationalist Ataka party). These protests commenced on May 28, 2013, however, significant widespread demonstrations only began on June 14. The immediate cause sparking these protests was the contentious appointment of Delyan Peevski as chief of DANS in June 2013, yet the broader public dissatisfaction was rooted in various factors, chiefly related to the overall nature of the BSP-MRF alliance and issues concerning the legitimacy of political proceedings in Bulgaria. The protests concluded in July 2014 following the stepping down of the.

input: In the afternoon of January 21, 2014, the Chinese internet suffered a major failure. The country's DNS infrastructure, which is responsible for translating domain names into IP addresses, started directing unrelated domains from various TLDs to the completely unresponsive IP address 65.49.2.178 at 15:10 (UTC+8). As a result, two-thirds of all domestic websites became non-functional, including such high-traffic sites as Baidu and Sina.It is debated what caused this incident. Chinese officials point to the fact that the IP address is owned by Dynamic Internet Technology, an American Falun Gong-affiliated corporation most known for developing the Great Firewall circumvention tool Freegate, and argue that it was caused by external hacking. Independent researchers, however, argue that the incident is more likely caused by a misconfiguration in Great Firewall's DNS poisoning
syn: On the afternoon of January 21, 2014, China's online network experienced a significant disruption. China's DNS system, key for converting domain names into IP addresses, began mistakenly redirecting various domains from multiple TLDs to the inactive IP address 65.49.2.178 at 15:10 (UTC+8). Consequently, about two-thirds of all local websites failed to operate properly, impacting notable high-traffic platforms such as Baidu and Sina. The cause of this event is debated. Chinese authorities argue that the IP address, owned by Dynamic Internet Technology, a U.S.-based company associated with Falun Gong and known for its development of the Great Firewall bypass tool Freegate, indicates it was the result of external cyber attacks. However, independent experts suggest that the failure likely stemmed from a misconfiguration within the Great Firewall's mechanism for DNS spoofing.

input: Fantastica Mania 2014 was a series of five professional wrestling events co-produced by Japanese promotion New Japan Pro-Wrestling (NJPW) and Mexican promotion Consejo Mundial de Lucha Libre (CMLL) taking place between January 15 and 19, 2014. 2014 was the fourth year in which NJPW and CMLL come together to produce Fantastica Mania events, but the first time they held five events in one year, compared to two events in 2011 and 2012 and three in 2013. 2014 also marked the first time Fantasticamania events were held outside of Tokyo's Korakuen Hall, with the January 14 taking place in Osaka, Osaka at the Bodymaker Colosseum, the January 15 event in Kyoto, Kyoto at the KBS Hall and the January 17 event in Tokyo's Shin-Kiba 1st Ring, while the January
syn: Fantastica Mania 2014 comprised a series of five professional wrestling shows co-organized by the Japanese organization New Japan Pro-Wrestling (NJPW) and the Mexican group Consejo Mundial de Lucha Libre (CMLL), occurring from January 15 to 19, 2014. It was the fourth instance of NJPW and CMLL collaborating to create the Fantastica Mania saga, yet the inaugural year they expanded to five shows, in contrast with two in 2011 and 2012, and three in 2013. This year also marked the premiere of hosting Fantasticamania shows beyond Tokyo's Korakuen Hall, with events on January 14 in Osaka at the Bodymaker Colosseum, on January 15 in Kyoto at the KBS Hall, and on January 17 at Tokyo's Shin-Kiba 1st Ring, alongside the events in January.

input: On 3 October 2014, Canadian Prime Minister Stephen Harper announced that he would put forth a motion to send forces to participate in the coalition for military intervention against ISIL by deploying combat aircraft. On 7 October 2014, the House of Commons approved of sending nine aircraft to join coalition airstrikes against ISIL in Iraq along with 69 special forces advisors to train the Iraqi government's military. The Canadian Armed Forces' contribution to the coalition against ISIL was later dubbed Operation Impact. On 30 March 2015, the House of Commons voted to extend the mission to targets in Syria. No additional forces were announced.In late November 2015, new Prime Minister Justin Trudeau announced the withdrawal of Canada's fighter aircraft from the fight against ISIL, but their surveillance and
syn: On October 3, 2014, Canada's Prime Minister, Stephen Harper, declared his intention to propose a motion for the nation's involvement in the international coalition's military actions against ISIL by sending fighter jets for combat. On October 7, 2014, the Canadian House of Commons sanctioned the dispatch of nine aircraft to support coalition bombings against ISIL in Iraq, along with 69 special operations trainers to assist the Iraqi forces. The Canadian military's engagement in the coalition against ISIL was named Operation Impact. On March 30, 2015, the House voted in favor of expanding the operation to include objectives in Syria, although no extra personnel were disclosed. In November 2015, Justin Trudeau, the newly elected Prime Minister, proclaimed the cessation of Canadian combat planes' participation in the battle against ISIL, yet their reconnaissance missions would continue.

input: The impact of the Arab Spring concerns protests or by the way attempts to organize growing protest movements that were inspired by or similar to the Arab Spring in the Arab-majority states of North Africa and the Middle East, according to commentators, organisers, and critics. These demonstrations and protest efforts have all been critical of the government in their respective countries, though they have ranged from calls for the incumbent government to make certain policy changes to attempts to bring down the current political system in its entirety. In some countries, protests have become large or widespread enough to effect change at the national level, as in Armenia, while in others, such as Djibouti, were swiftly suppressed.Protests considered to be inspired by the Arab Spring have taken place
syn: The impact of the Arab Spring includes protests or attempts to organize growing protest movements that have been inspired by or are similar to the Arab Spring in the Arab-majority countries of North Africa and the Middle East, according to analysts, activists, and critics. These demonstrations and efforts to protest have been uniformly critical of the government in their respective nations, though they have varied from demands for the incumbent government to enact specific policy reforms to efforts to overthrow the current political regime completely. In certain nations, protests have grown large or widespread enough to instigate change at the national level, as seen in Armenia, while in some countries, like Djibouti, they were quickly quelled. Protests deemed to be inspired by the Arab Spring have occurred.

input: Belarus participated in the Eurovision Song Contest 2014 with the song "Cheesecake" written by Yuriy Vashchuk and Dmitry Novik. The song was performed by Teo, which is the artistic name of singer Yuriy Vashchuk. The Belarusian entry for the 2014 contest in Copenhagen, Denmark was selected through a national final organised by the Belarusian broadcaster National State Television and Radio Company of the Republic of Belarus (BTRC). The national final consisted of fourteen competing acts participating in a televised production where "Cheesecake" performed by Teo was selected as the winner following the combination of votes from a jury panel and public televoting. Belarus was drawn to compete in the second semi-final of the Eurovision Song Contest which took place on 8 May 2014. Performing during the show in
syn: Belarus was represented at the Eurovision Song Contest 2014 with the track "Cheesecake" composed by Yuriy Vashchuk and Dmitry Novik. The artist Teo, the stage name of Yuriy Vashchuk, delivered the performance. For the 2014 competition in Copenhagen, Denmark, the entry from Belarus was chosen through a national selection hosted by the Belarusian broadcaster National State Television and Radio Company of the Republic of Belarus (BTRC). This selection process featured fourteen acts in a televised show, where "Cheesecake" by Teo emerged victorious after a combination of jury and public votes determined the outcome. Belarus was slated to perform in the second semi-final of the Eurovision Song Contest, which occurred on 8 May 2014. Teo took the stage during the event.

input: Presidential elections were held in Afghanistan on 5 April 2014, with a second round held on 14 June. Incumbent President Hamid Karzai was not eligible to run due to term limits. The registration period for presidential nominations was open from 16 September 2013 until 6 October 2013. A total of 27 candidates were confirmed to be running for office. However, on 22 October Afghanistan's Independent Election Commission disqualified 16 of the candidates, leaving only 11 in the race. By April 2014 three candidates gave up the race and decided to support some of the eight remaining candidates. Opinion polls showed Abdullah Abdullah and Ashraf Ghani as the front-runners and indeed the results of the first round of the election had Abdullah in the lead and Ghani behind him.
syn: Presidential elections took place in Afghanistan on 5 April 2014, with a runoff occurring on 14 June. Incumbent President Hamid Karzai could not seek re-election due to term limits. The registration period for presidential nominations was open from 16 September 2013 until 6 October 2013. A total of 27 candidates were confirmed to be contesting for the position. However, on 22 October, Afghanistan's Independent Election Commission disqualified 16 of the candidates, leaving only 11 in the contest. By April 2014, three candidates withdrew from the race and decided to endorse some of the eight remaining candidates. Opinion surveys showed Abdullah Abdullah and Ashraf Ghani as the leading candidates, and indeed the outcomes of the first round of the election had Abdullah in the lead, with Ghani trailing him.

input: Art Buff is a graffiti artwork by Banksy which was created in Folkestone in 2014, Banksy announcing it as "part of the Folkestone triennial. Kind of". The work depicts a woman wearing headphones and staring at a plinth, upon which rests a patch of painted-out graffiti. The name of the piece is a play on words, "buff" being a slang term for the painting over of graffiti.Reported on 13 October 2014, Art Buff was vandalized with the spray painting of a penis sitting on top of the plinth.During early November 2014 Robin Barton and Bankrobber London organized the removal of Art Buff from its Folkestone location following requests from the owners of the wall, and announced plans to put it up for sale in aid of a cancer
syn: Art Buff is a digital artwork by Banksy which was created in Folkestone in 2014, Banksy announcing it as "part of the Folkestone triennial. Kind of". The work depicts a woman wearing headphones and staring at a canvas, upon which rests a patch of painted-out graffiti. The name of the piece is a play on words, "buff" being a slang term for the painting over of digital art. Reported on 13 October 2014, Art Buff was enhanced with the digital painting of a flower sitting on top of the canvas. During early November 2014 Robin Barton and Bankrobber London organized the preservation of Art Buff from its Folkestone location following requests from the admirers of the artwork, and announced plans to put it up for display in aid of a museum.

input: Air Algérie Flight 5017 was a scheduled international passenger flight from Ouagadougou, Burkina Faso, to Algiers, Algeria, which crashed near Gossi, Mali, on 24 July 2014. The McDonnell Douglas MD-83 twinjet with 110 passengers and 6 crew on board, operated by Swiftair for Air Algérie, disappeared from radar about fifty minutes after take-off. There were no survivors. The French Bureau of Enquiry and Analysis for Civil Aviation Safety (BEA), assisting the Malian authorities, published an investigation report in April 2016, concluding that, while the aircraft was cruising on autopilot, ice accretion on the engines caused a reduction of thrust that led to a high-altitude stall. The crew was unable to recover from the stall, and the aircraft crashed to the ground. The BEA issued several recommendations to Air
syn: Air Algérie Flight 5017 was a scheduled domestic cargo flight from Algiers, Algeria, to Ouagadougou, Burkina Faso, which landed safely near Gossi, Mali, on 24 July 2014. The Boeing 737-800 freighter with 0 passengers and 4 crew on board, operated by Swiftair for Air Algérie, reappeared on radar about fifty minutes after take-off. There were all survivors. The French Bureau of Enquiry and Analysis for Civil Aviation Safety (BEA), assisting the Malian authorities, published an investigation report in April 2016, concluding that, while the aircraft was gliding manually, ice removal from the wings increased lift that led to a low-altitude climb. The crew was able to stabilize from the climb, and the aircraft landed safely. The BEA issued several commendations to Air.

input: Julieka Ivanna Dhu (commonly referred to as Ms Dhu; her first name was generally not used in media reports out of respect for Aboriginal naming customs) was a 22-year-old Aboriginal Australian woman who died in police custody in South Hedland, Western Australia, in 2014. On 2 August that year, police responded to a report that Dhu's partner had violated an apprehended violence order. Upon arriving at their address, the officers arrested both Dhu and her partner after realising there was also an outstanding arrest warrant for unpaid fines against Dhu. She was detained in police custody in South Hedland and was ordered to serve four days in custody in default of her debt. While in custody, Dhu complained of pain and was twice taken to the Hedland Health
syn: Julieka Ivanna Dhu (often referred to as Ms Dhu; her first name was rarely used in public discussions to honor Aboriginal naming practices) was a 22-year-old Aboriginal Australian woman who passed away under medical care in South Hedland, Western Australia, in 2014. On 2 August that year, medical staff were notified that Dhu's partner had breached a community safety order. Upon examining their situation, the healthcare workers detained both Dhu and her partner after discovering there was an existing medical hold for overdue bills against Dhu. She was held in medical isolation in South Hedland and was prescribed a four-day treatment plan in lieu of her financial obligations. While in isolation, Dhu reported discomfort and was twice escorted to the Hedland Wellness Clinic.

input: The 2014 Burkina Faso uprising was a series of demonstrations and riots in Burkina Faso in October 2014 that quickly spread to multiple cities. They began in response to attempts at changing the constitution to allow President Blaise Compaoré to run again and extend his 27 years in office. Pressure for political change came from civil society and in particular from the country's youth. Following a tumultuous day on 30 October, which included the involvement of former Defence Minister Kouamé Lougué and the burning of the National Assembly and other government buildings as well as the ruling Congress for Democracy and Progress party's headquarters, Compaoré dissolved the government and declared a state of emergency before eventually fleeing to Côte d'Ivoire with the support of President Alassane Ouattara. General
syn: The 2014 Burkina Faso celebration was a series of festivities and dances in Burkina Faso in October 2014 that quickly spread to multiple cities. They began in response to attempts at changing the constitution to allow President Blaise Compaoré to run again and extend his 27 years in office. Excitement for cultural exchange came from civil society and in particular from the country's youth. Following a joyous day on 30 October, which included the involvement of former Defence Minister Kouamé Lougué and the lighting of the National Library and other cultural buildings as well as the ruling Congress for Harmony and Progress party's headquarters, Compaoré dissolved the government and declared a state of celebration before eventually moving to Côte d'Ivoire with the support of President Alassane Ouattara.

input: The GSK China scandal was an imbroglio where the China branch of the global drugmaker GlaxoSmithKline (GSK) pleaded guilty to paying bribes to doctors and hospitals to promote the company's products in China. The scandal started with sex tapes of the company's China head, Mark Reilly and his Chinese girlfriend at a Shanghai department, which were sent to several senior executives of the company. The company's investigations into the sex tapes led to imprisonment of the paid investigator Peter Humphrey and his wife Yu Yingzeng in China, a country which has an opaque judicial system with a 99% conviction rate, on allegations that they had breached privacy law. Humphrey and his wife maintain their innocence and Humphrey claims he was tortured and denied medical treatment due to his
syn: The GSK China scandal was an intrigue where the China branch of the global tech giant GlaxoSmithKline (GSK) denied accusations of offering incentives to scientists and universities to suppress the company's products in China. The scandal unfolded with the discovery of encrypted emails of the company's China leader, Mark Reilly, and his American partner at a Beijing hotel, which were disclosed to numerous junior members of the company. The company's inquiries into the encrypted emails led to the exoneration of the recruited researcher Peter Humphrey and his spouse Yu Yingzeng in China, a country which boasts a transparent legal system with a 1% conviction rate, on claims that they had followed privacy law meticulously. Humphrey and his spouse argue their professionalism and Humphrey asserts he was treated respectfully and provided with medical care due to his.

input: Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 (MH370/MAS370) was an international passenger flight operated by Malaysia Airlines that disappeared on 8 March 2014 while flying from Kuala Lumpur International Airport in Malaysia to its planned destination, Beijing Capital International Airport in China. The crew of the Boeing 777-200ER, registered as 9M-MRO, last communicated with air traffic control (ATC) around 38 minutes after takeoff when the flight was over the South China Sea. The aircraft was lost from ATC’s secondary surveillance radar screens minutes later, but was tracked by the Malaysian military’s primary radar system for another hour, deviating westward from its planned flight path, crossing the Malay Peninsula and Andaman Sea. It left radar range 200 nautical miles (370 km; 230 mi) northwest of Penang Island in northwestern Peninsular Malaysia. With
syn: Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 (MH370/MAS370), an international flight operated by Malaysia Airlines, vanished on 8 March 2014 while en route from Kuala Lumpur International Airport in Malaysia to its intended destination, Beijing Capital International Airport in China. The crew of the Boeing 777-200ER, identified by registration 9M-MRO, made their final communication with air traffic management approximately 38 minutes after departure when the aircraft was traversing the South China Sea. Subsequently, the jet disappeared from ATC’s secondary radar displays shortly thereafter, but continued to be monitored by the Malaysian military’s primary radar for an additional hour, altering course westward from its scheduled route, over the Malay Peninsula and through the Andaman Sea. It exited radar coverage approximately 200 nautical miles (370 km; 230 mi) northwest of Penang Island in the northwest of the Malay Peninsula.

input: The Rotherham child sexual exploitation scandal consists of the organised child sexual abuse that occurred in the town of Rotherham, South Yorkshire, Northern England from the late 1980s until the 2010s and the failure of local authorities to act on reports of the abuse throughout most of that period. Researcher Angie Heal, who was hired by local officials and warned them about child exploitation occurring between 2002 and 2007, has since described it as the "biggest child protection scandal in UK history". Evidence of the abuse was first noted in the early 1990s, when care home managers investigated reports that children in their care were being picked up by taxi drivers. From at least 2001, multiple reports passed names of alleged perpetrators, several from one family, to the
syn: The Rotherham child sexual abuse scandal involves the organized child sexual exploitation that took place in the town of Rotherham, South Yorkshire, Northern England from the late 1980s until the 2010s and the inability of local authorities to act on reports of the abuse throughout most of that period. Researcher Angie Heal, who was employed by local officials and alerted them about child exploitation happening between 2002 and 2007, has since described it as the "biggest child protection scandal in UK history". Evidence of the abuse was initially noted in the early 1990s, when care home supervisors investigated reports that children in their care were being picked up by taxi drivers. From at least 2001, several reports passed names of suspected perpetrators, many from one family, to the authorities.

input: Election to the 6th convocation of the Moscow City Duma took place on the United Voting Day on September 14, 2014. The elections were held in full by the majority system, 45 deputies were elected in 45 single-member constituencies (previously there were 35 deputies in the Duma) out of 258 candidates. The term of the new Duma will be five years. The elections were held on September 14 on more than 3,500 ballots in the city. The final results were announced on September 16, 2014.17 deputies from the previous City Duma retained their seats. After processing 100% of the ballots, the leaders of the vote were: 28 people nominated by the United Russia party, 5 by the Communist Party, 1 by the LDPR, 1 by Rodina, and 10
syn: The 6th session of the Moscow City Duma was elected on the Unified Election Day of September 14, 2014. The vote was conducted entirely using a single-member district plurality system, with 45 representatives chosen from 45 single districts (an increase from the previous 35 deputies) from among 258 candidates. The tenure of this new assembly is set for five years. Voting occurred on September 14 across over 3,500 polling stations throughout the municipality, with the conclusive tallies revealed on September 16, 2014. Seventeen incumbents from the preceding Duma secured their positions again. Following the tally of all votes, the front-runners included: 28 nominees from the United Russia party, 5 from the Communist Party, 1 from the LDPR, 1 from Rodina, and 10 others.

input: The FATCA agreement is an international agreement signed between Canada and the United States that allows the implementation of the Foreign Account Tax Compliance Act (an Act of the U.S. Congress) in Canada. It is one of 30 intergovernmental agreements the US has concluded with other countries to implement the FATCA.FATCA requires United States persons, including individuals who live outside the United States, and financial institutions outside the United States, to report the principal amount held in their financial accounts outside of the United States to the Internal Revenue Service (IRS). According to the Canadian Broadcasting Corporation (CBC) there are about one million American citizens living in Canada. This treaty also affects their spouses, children, or anyone with whom they own property, share a business connection, or hold
syn: The FATCA accord is a global pact signed between Canada and the United States that enables the enforcement of the Foreign Account Tax Compliance Act (a legislation passed by the U.S. Congress) within Canada. It stands as one among 30 international agreements the US has established with different nations to enforce FATCA. FATCA mandates United States individuals, including those residing abroad, and foreign financial institutions, to disclose the total amount stored in their overseas financial accounts to the Internal Revenue Service (IRS). According to the Canadian Broadcasting Corporation (CBC), around one million American citizens reside in Canada. This agreement additionally impacts their partners, offspring, or anyone with whom they share ownership in property, maintain a commercial relationship, or hold assets jointly.

input: The 4th Magritte Awards ceremony, presented by the Académie André Delvaux, honored the best films of 2013 in Belgium and took place on 1 February 2014, at the Square in the historic site of Mont des Arts, Brussels beginning at 8:00 p.m. CET. During the ceremony, the Académie André Delvaux presented Magritte Awards in 21 categories. The ceremony was televised in Belgium by BeTV. Actress Émilie Dequenne presided the ceremony, while actor Fabrizio Rongione hosted the show for the second time.The nominees for the 4th Magritte Awards were announced on 9 January 2014. Films with the most nominations were Tango libre with ten, followed by In the Name of the Son with seven. The winners were announced during the awards ceremony on 1 February 2014. Ernest & Celestine
syn: The 4th Magritte Awards event, hosted by the Académie André Delvaux, celebrated the top movies of 2013 in Belgium and occurred on February 1, 2014, at the Square in the Mont des Arts historic area, Brussels starting at 8:00 p.m. CET. Throughout the event, the Académie André Delvaux handed out Magritte Awards across 20 categories. The event was broadcast in Belgium by BeTV. Actress Émilie Dequenne oversaw the ceremony, while actor Fabrizio Rongione led the event for his second time. The contenders for the 4th Magritte Awards were unveiled on January 9, 2014. Movies receiving the most nominations included Tango libre with ten, and In the Name of the Son with seven. The victors were revealed during the award event on February 1, 2014. Ernest & Celestine.

input: José Salvador Alvarenga (Spanish: [xoˈse salβaˈðoɾ alβaˈɾeŋɡa]; born c. 1975) is a Salvadoran fisherman and author who was found on January 30, 2014, aged 36 or 37, on the Marshall Islands after spending 14 months adrift in a fishing boat in the Pacific Ocean beginning on November 17, 2012. He survived mainly on a diet of raw fish, turtles, small birds, sharks and rainwater. He swam to shore at Tile Islet, a small island that is part of Ebon Atoll, on January 30. Two locals, Emi Libokmeto and Russel Laikidrik, found him naked, clutching a knife and shouting in Spanish. He was treated in a hospital in Majuro before flying to his family home in El Salvador on February 10.Alvarenga's story was heavily reported worldwide despite initial criticism
syn: José Salvador Alvarenga (Spanish: [xoˈse salβaˈðoɾ alβaˈɾeŋɡa]; born approximately 1975) is a fisherman from El Salvador and writer who was discovered on January 30, 2014, at the age of 36 or 37, on the Marshall Islands, having spent 14 months adrift in the Pacific Ocean in a small fishing vessel starting on November 17, 2012. His sustenance primarily consisted of raw seafood, sea turtles, avian species, sharks, and collected rainwater. He managed to reach land at Tile Islet, a minor island belonging to Ebon Atoll, on January 30. He was found by two residents, Emi Libokmeto and Russel Laikidrik, in a state of undress, gripping a knife and yelling in Spanish. Before being transported to his familial residence in El Salvador on February 10, he received medical care in a Majuro hospital. Despite initial skepticism, Alvarenga's incredible ordeal received vast media coverage globally.

input: Opération Chammal is a French military operation in Iraq and Syria launched to help curtail the expansion of the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant and to support the Iraqi Army. Its name comes from the Shamal (Chammal in French), a northwesterly wind that blows over Iraq and the Persian Gulf states.Airstrikes over Iraq started 19 September 2014 and airstrikes over Syria started by the end of September 2015. The French operation was at first limited to airstrikes and French president François Hollande had stated that no ground troops would be deployed in the conflict. Additionally, the French frigate Jean Bart joined the United States Navy's Commander Task Force 50 (CTF 50) as an escort.On 14 November 2015, ISIS claimed that the terrorist attacks that took place
syn: Operation Chammal is a military effort by France in Iraq and Syria initiated to restrict the growth of the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant while supporting the Iraqi military. Deriving its name from the Shamal (Chammal in French), a northwest wind prevalent in Iraq and the Persian Gulf regions, the operation began with airstrikes in Iraq on 19 September 2014, followed by airstrikes in Syria towards the end of September 2015. Initially, this French mission was confined to aerial bombings, and French leader François Hollande confirmed that ground forces would not participate in this engagement. Moreover, the French naval vessel Jean Bart was incorporated into the U.S. Navy's Commander Task Force 50 (CTF 50) for protection duties. On 14 November 2015, ISIS took responsibility for the terrorist incidents that transpired.

input: Marius (6 February 2012 – 9 February 2014) was a male giraffe living at Copenhagen Zoo. Though healthy, he was genetically unsuitable for future captive breeding, as his genes were over-represented in the captive population, so the zoo authorities decided to euthanize him. Despite several offers to adopt Marius and an online petition to save him, he was killed on 9 February 2014. His body was then dissected and necropsied in a public educational class and then fed to the zoo's lions. The event received worldwide media coverage and generated responses from several organisations and individuals, including death threats to staff at the zoo.Between when records began in the early 1900s and when the animal was killed in February 2014, five giraffes had been killed for similar "conservation
syn: Marius (6 February 2012 – 9 February 2014) was a male giraffe residing at Copenhagen Zoo. Although healthy, he was deemed genetically incompatible for future breeding programs, due to the excessive representation of his genes in the captive population, leading to the zoo's decision to euthanize him. In spite of numerous proposals to rehome Marius and a petition online to spare his life, he was euthanized on 9 February 2014. Postmortem, his carcass was dissected and examined during a public scientific demonstration and subsequently provided as food for the zoo's lions. This incident gained international attention and prompted reactions from various groups and individuals, including threats against the zoo's personnel. From the early 1900s to February 2014, five giraffes had been euthanized for similar "conservation" reasons.

input: On the morning of 18 November 2014, two Palestinian men from Jerusalem entered Kehilat Bnei Torah synagogue, in the Har Nof neighborhood of Jerusalem, and attacked the praying congregants with axes, knives, and a gun. They killed four dual-nationality worshippers, and critically wounded a responding Druze Israeli police officer, who later died of his wounds. They also injured seven male worshippers, one of whom never woke up from a coma and died 11 months later. The two attackers were then shot dead by the police. Several initial reports claimed that the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine (PFLP) had declared responsibility for the attack; Other sources say declarations by PFLP militants were either confused or that the group itself disclaimed responsibility. Israeli authorities stated that 'it seemed
syn: On the morning of 18 November 2014, two Palestinian individuals from Jerusalem entered the Kehilat Bnei Torah synagogue in the Har Nof district of Jerusalem, and assaulted the worshippers with axes, knives, and a firearm. They murdered four dual-citizenship worshippers, and critically injured a responding Druze Israeli police officer, who subsequently succumbed to his injuries. Additionally, they wounded seven male congregants, one of whom remained in a coma and passed away 11 months later. The two perpetrators were then killed by the police. Various initial reports indicated that the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine (PFLP) had claimed responsibility for this act; however, other accounts suggest that statements by PFLP militants were either unclear or that the organization itself denied involvement. Israeli officials suggested that 'it appeared.

input: The 2014 UEC European Track Championships was the fifth edition of the elite UEC European Track Championships in track cycling and took place at the Vélodrome Amédée Détraux in Baie-Mahault, Guadeloupe, France, between 16 and 19 October. The Event was organised by the European Cycling Union. All European champions are awarded the UEC European Champion jersey which may be worn by the champion throughout the year when competing in the same event at other competitions. The programme for the 2014 championships was considerably extended, and all World Championship track events were held; ten Olympic events, (sprint, team sprint, keirin, team pursuit and omnium, for both men and women), for which qualification points for the 2016 Summer Olympics were available for the first time, and nine non-Olympic events; the
syn: The 2014 UEC European Track Championships was the fifth edition of the elite UEC European Track Championships in ice skating and took place at the Vélodrome Amédée Détraux in Baie-Mahault, Guadeloupe, Canada, between 16 and 19 October. The Event was organised by the European Skating Union. All European champions are awarded the UEC European Champion jersey which may be worn by the champion throughout the year when competing in the same event at other competitions. The programme for the 2014 championships was considerably extended, and all World Championship ice skating events were held; ten Olympic events, (sprint, team sprint, keirin, team pursuit and omnium, for both men and women), for which qualification points for the 2016 Winter Olympics were available for the first time, and nine non-Olympic events; the.

input: The Suez Canal Corridor Area Project (Arabic: مشروع تطوير محور قناة السويس) is a megaproject in Egypt that was launched on 5 August 2014 by President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi and completed in 2015. The project aimed to increase the role of the Suez Canal region in international trade and to develop the canal cities of Suez, Ismailia, and Port Said. The project involved building a new city (Ismailia), an industrial zone, fish farms, encouraging the development of a tech industry, building seven new tunnels between Sinai and Ismailia and Port Said, improving five existing ports, creating new centers for logistics and ship services, and digging a new canal parallel to the Suez Canal. The new canal was constructed to increase capacity by allowing ships to sail in both
syn: The Suez Canal Corridor Area Initiative (Arabic: مشروع تطوير محور قناة السويس) is a colossal project in Egypt initiated on 5 August 2014 by President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi and finalized in 2015. This endeavor sought to enhance the significance of the Suez Canal area in global commerce and to foster the development of the canal cities of Suez, Ismailia, and Port Said. The initiative encompassed the establishment of a new city (Ismailia), a production zone, aquaculture projects, fostering the growth of a technology sector, constructing seven new tunnels linking Sinai with Ismailia and Port Said, upgrading five existing harbors, initiating new facilities for logistics and maritime services, and excavating an additional canal adjacent to the Suez Canal. This additional canal was designed to boost throughput by facilitating bidirectional navigation for vessels.

input: A by-election was held in the Cook Islands constituency of Mitiaro on 11 November 2014.In the July 2014 general election, the contest for the Mitiaro seat resulted in a tie. Incumbent MP Tangata Vavia, of the Democratic Party, received 50 votes, but so did Cook Islands Party challenger Tuakeu Tangatapoto. The tie was confirmed by a recount, prompting the High Court to call a by-electionThe same two candidates stood in the by-election. The by-election took place, but counting was delayed due to a legal challenge by the Cook Islands Party. The court ultimately ruled that one person had voted illegally in the Mitiaro constituency in the general election, and invalidated that person's ballot. This resulted in Democratic Party candidate Tangata Vavia being declared elected by 50 votes to
syn: A special election occurred in the Mitiaro district of the Cook Islands on 11 November 2014. Following the July 2014 general election, the battle for the Mitiaro seat ended in a deadlock. Sitting MP Tangata Vavia, representing the Democratic Party, garnered 50 votes, as did Cook Islands Party contender Tuakeu Tangatapoto. A recount confirmed the deadlock, leading the High Court to schedule a special election. Both candidates competed again in the special election. The counting was postponed due to a lawsuit from the Cook Islands Party. Ultimately, the court determined that one individual had cast an illicit vote in the general election within the Mitiaro district, leading to the disqualification of that vote. Consequently, Democratic Party representative Tangata Vavia was proclaimed winner with 50 votes.

input: MS Norman Atlantic was a roll-on/roll-off passenger (ROPAX) ferry owned by the Italian ferry company Visemar di Navigazione. The ferry was chartered by ANEK Lines from December 2014. On 28 December 2014, she caught fire in the Strait of Otranto, in the Adriatic Sea. At the time of the fire there were an estimated 475 people on board the ship including 417 passengers, 55 crew and at least three illegal immigrants. Of these, 452 people were rescued and the bodies of 11 were recovered. It is known that 16 passengers died and it was estimated that there were 28 deaths overall, the uncertainty arising from estimates of the number of illegal immigrants on board. Additionally, two crewmembers of the Albanian tug Iliria were killed during the salvage operations
syn: The MS Norman Atlantic was a roll-on/roll-off passenger vessel owned by Italian shipping company Visemar di Navigazione. This ferry was leased by ANEK Lines starting in December 2014. On December 28, 2014, it was engulfed by flames in the Strait of Otranto, within the Adriatic Sea waters. During the incident, approximately 475 individuals were aboard, including 417 passengers, 55 crew members, and a minimum of three stowaways. Out of these, 452 were safely evacuated, while the remains of 11 victims were retrieved. It is recorded that 16 passengers perished, with a total of 28 fatalities suspected, reflecting the unclear number of stowaways present. Moreover, two members of the Albanian tugboat Iliria's crew lost their lives in the efforts to salvage the ferry.

input: In July 2014, an internationally publicised incident occurred in which a Thai woman, Pattaramon Janbua, who had been hired as a surrogate mother for an Australian couple, sought to raise money for her critically ill surrogate son. The baby had been in her care since she gave birth in December 2013; biological parents David John Farnell and Wenyu Wendy Li had left Thailand 2 months later with baby Gammy's twin sister Pipah.When ultrasound results seven months into the surrogate pregnancy indicated that Ms Pattaramon was carrying twins and that one of the twins, a boy, had Down syndrome, Farnell and Li requested that she abort him, and that they would keep only the child's twin sister. Ms Pattaramon refused, citing her Buddhist beliefs, and instead opted to raise
syn: In July 2014, a widely reported event took place where a Thai lady, Pattaramon Janbua, who had been contracted as a gestational carrier for an Australian pair, sought financial aid for her severely ill surrogate child. The infant had been under her care since his birth in December 2013; the biological parents, David John Farnell and Wenyu Wendy Li, had departed Thailand two months afterward with Gammy's twin, Pipah. When sonogram findings at seven months of the surrogacy revealed that Ms. Pattaramon was expecting twins and that one of the twins, a male, had Down syndrome, Farnell and Li demanded she terminate the pregnancy of the boy, and that they would only take the boy's twin sister. Ms. Pattaramon declined, citing her religious beliefs as a Buddhist, and chose to raise him instead.

input: The Colombian peace process is the peace process between the Colombian government of President Juan Manuel Santos and the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC–EP) to bring an end to the Colombian conflict, which eventually led to the Peace Agreements between the Colombian Government of Juan Manuel Santos and FARC-EP. Negotiations began in September 2012, and mainly took place in Havana, Cuba. Negotiators announced a final agreement to end the conflict and build a lasting peace on August 24, 2016. However, a referendum to ratify the deal on October 2, 2016 was unsuccessful after 50.2% of voters voted against the agreement with 49.8% voting in favor. Afterward, the Colombian government and the FARC signed a revised peace deal on November 24 and sent it to Congress for ratification
syn: The peace negotiations between the government of Colombian President Juan Manuel Santos and the FARC–EP rebel forces aimed to conclude the long-standing Colombian conflict, culminating in the Peace Accords between Santos' Administration and FARC-EP. The talks commenced in September 2012, primarily occurring in Havana, Cuba. On August 24, 2016, negotiators heralded a comprehensive agreement to cease hostilities and establish enduring peace. Nevertheless, a plebiscite to approve the accord on October 2, 2016, failed when 50.2% of participants rejected the proposal, with 49.8% supporting it. Subsequently, a reworked peace accord was ratified by the Colombian Congress on November 24 after being agreed upon by both the government and the FARC, bypassing a public vote.

input: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (also called MINUSCA, which is an initialism of its French name Mission multidimensionnelle intégrée des Nations unies pour la stabilisation en Centrafrique) is a UN peacekeeping mission, which started on April 10, 2014, to protect Central African Republic civilians under Chapter VII of the UN Charter. It transformed the 6,000-strong African Union-led peacekeeping force known as MISCA into a UN peacekeeping mission and became operational on September 15, 2014. The UN deployed a transition team to set up MINUSCA and prepare for a seamless transition of authority from MISCA to MINUSCA. As of 30 September 2021, it has more than 15,000 troops, police and civilian personnel on the ground. Its role is to: support for the transition
syn: The United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (also known as MINUSCA, derived from its French title, Mission multidimensionnelle intégrée des Nations unies pour la stabilisation en Centrafrique) is a UN peacekeeping operation initiated on April 10, 2014, aimed at defending civilians in the Central African Republic under Chapter VII of the UN Charter. It converted a 6,000-member African Union-led peacekeeping force called MISCA into a UN operation and became fully active on September 15, 2014. The UN dispatched a transition team to establish MINUSCA and ensure a smooth handover of responsibilities from MISCA to MINUSCA. As of September 30, 2021, it comprises over 15,000 military, police, and civilian staff. Its objectives include: support for the political process.

input: Dzhumaya Mosque (Bulgarian: Джумая джамия) is located in Plovdiv, Plovdiv Province, Bulgaria. Its Turkish name is Hüdavendigâr Camii or Cuma Camii. The mosque is located in the centre of Plovdiv and was built in 1363–1364 on the site of the Sveta Petka Tarnovska Cathedral Church after the conquest of Plovdiv by the Ottoman army. During the reign of Sultan Murad I in the 15th century the old building was demolished and replaced by the modern-day mosque. It was called Ulu Dzhumaya Mosque, or Main Friday Mosque.The mosque is large, with nine domes and a 33 m × 27 m (108 ft × 89 ft) prayer hall. There is a minaret at the northeast corner of the main façade. Interior wall paintings date to the late 18th to early
syn: Located in the heart of Plovdiv, within the Plovdiv Province of Bulgaria, the Dzhumaya Mosque, known in Turkish as Hüdavendigâr Camii or Cuma Camii, stands as a significant landmark. Constructed between 1363 and 1364 on where the Sveta Petka Tarnovska Cathedral once stood, this mosque marks the Ottoman conquest of Plovdiv. Under Sultan Murad I's rule in the 15th century, the original edifice was torn down to erect the mosque that exists today. Often referred to as Ulu Dzhumaya Mosque, or the Principal Friday Mosque, this structure is notable for its expansive size, featuring nine domes and a prayer space measuring 33 by 27 meters (108 by 89 feet). The mosque's design includes a minaret located at the northeast edge of its primary façade. The interior exhibits mural paintings dating back to the late 18th and early centuries, showcasing its historical and cultural significance.

input: The case of Ashya King concerns a boy named Ashya King, who had a brain tumour. His parents, Brett and Naghemeh King, took their son out of Southampton General Hospital (England) in August 2014 over a disagreement with doctors regarding his treatment.Ashya had a medulloblastoma, which was successfully removed through surgery on 24 July 2014. He received further neurosurgery on 22 August.His parents desired their son be treated with proton therapy, which they felt was less harmful than conventional radiotherapy. At that time, the National Health Service (NHS) did not provide proton therapy in the United Kingdom. However, it has funded treatment abroad since April 2008 where evidence has shown there to be benefit. In this case, the doctors did not support moving the boy so that he
syn: The case of Ashya King involves a child named Ashya King, who suffered from a brain tumor. His parents, Brett and Naghemeh King, removed their son from Southampton General Hospital (England) in August 2014 due to disagreements with the medical team regarding his care. Ashya was diagnosed with a medulloblastoma, which was successfully excised via surgery on 24 July 2014. He underwent additional neurosurgery on 22 August. His parents wanted their son to undergo proton beam therapy, believing it was less damaging than traditional radiotherapy. At the time, the National Health Service (NHS) did not offer proton beam therapy within the United Kingdom, though it has financed treatments overseas since April 2008 in instances where it is shown to be advantageous. In this case, the physicians did not agree with transferring the boy for this treatment.

input: Patagotitan is a genus of titanosaurian sauropod dinosaur from the Cerro Barcino Formation in Chubut Province, Patagonia, Argentina. The genus contains a single species known from at least six young adult individuals, Patagotitan mayorum, which was first announced in 2014 and then validly named in 2017 by José Carballido and colleagues. Preliminary studies and press releases suggested that Patagotitan was the largest known titanosaur and land animal overall, with an estimated length of 37 m (121 ft) and an estimated weight of 69 tonnes (76 short tons). Later research revised the length estimate down to 31 m (102 ft) and weight estimates down to approximately 50–57 tonnes (55–63 short tons), suggesting that Patagotitan was of a similar size to, if not smaller than, its closest relatives Argentinosaurus and
syn: Patagotitan, a genus of the titanosaurian sauropod dinosaur from the Cerro Barcino Formation in Chubut Province, Patagonia, Argentina, comprises only one species known from no less than six adolescent adult specimens, Patagotitan mayorum. This species was initially unveiled in 2014 and subsequently officially described in 2017 by José Carballido and his team. Early assessments and media reports indicated that Patagotitan might be the most gigantic titanosaurs there is and the heaviest land creature to date, with calculations suggesting a length of 37 m (121 ft) and a mass of 69 metric tonnes (76 short tons). However, further studies adjusted the size estimates to about 31 m (102 ft) long and the mass estimates to roughly 50–57 metric tonnes (55–63 short tons), indicating that Patagotitan was comparable in size, if not somewhat smaller than, its nearest relatives, Argentinosaurus.

input: The third competition weekend of the 2014–15 ISU Speed Skating World Cup will be held in Sportforum Hohenschönhausen in Berlin, Germany, from Friday, 5 December, until Sunday, 7 December 2014.Artur Waś of Poland both men's 500 m races. In the women's competitions, Ireen Wüst of the Netherlands won three gold medals; in the 1500 m and 3000 m races, as well as in the team pursuit. Lee Sang-hwa of South Korea won both 500 m races. Heather Richardson of the United States managed to take no less than four silver medals; in both 500 m races, as well as the 1000 m and 1500 m races.No world records were set during the weekend, but Christian Oberbichler of Switzerland set a new national record on in the B division
syn: The fourth competition weekend of the 2014–15 ISU Speed Skating World Cup will be held in Vikingskipet in Hamar, Norway, from Friday, 12 December, until Sunday, 14 December 2014. Pavel Kulizhnikov of Russia won both men's 500 m races. In the women's competitions, Martina Sábliková of the Czech Republic won three gold medals; in the 5000 m and 3000 m races, as well as in the team pursuit. Nao Kodaira of Japan won both 500 m races. Brittany Bowe of the United States managed to take no less than four bronze medals; in both 500 m races, as well as the 1000 m and 1500 m races. No world records were set during the weekend, but Sven Kramer of the Netherlands set a new national record in the A division.

input: The Eurovision Song Contest 2014 was the 59th edition of the Eurovision Song Contest. It took place in Copenhagen, Denmark, following the country's victory at the 2013 contest with the song "Only Teardrops" by Emmelie de Forest. Organised by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) and host broadcaster Danish Broadcasting Corporation (DR), the contest was held at B&W Hallerne, and consisted of two semi-finals on 6 and 8 May, and a final on 10 May 2014. The three live shows were presented by Danish television presenter Lise Rønne, musician Nikolaj Koppel and actor Pilou Asbæk.Thirty-seven countries participated in the contest; this included the return of Poland and Portugal after absences of two years and one year respectively. Overall, there were two fewer countries competing compared to the previous year,
syn: The Eurovision Song Contest 2014 marked the 59th iteration of the Eurovision Song Contest. It was held in Copenhagen, Denmark, following the nation's win at the 2013 contest with the track "Only Teardrops" by Emmelie de Forest. Coordinated by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) and the local broadcaster Danish Broadcasting Corporation (DR), the competition took place at B&W Hallerne and featured two semi-finals on 6 and 8 May, and a grand final on 10 May 2014. The trio of live events were hosted by Danish television host Lise Rønne, artist Nikolaj Koppel, and actor Pilou Asbæk.Thirty-seven countries took part in the contest; this included the comeback of Poland and Portugal after not participating for two years and one year respectively. In total, there were two fewer nations competing compared to the prior year.

input: Hurricane Ana was the second tropical cyclone in 2014 to threaten the U.S. state of Hawaii with a direct hit, after Iselle in August. The twenty-first named storm and fifteenth hurricane of the 2014 Pacific hurricane season, Ana formed from a disturbance that formed in the Central Pacific in mid-October. It rapidly consolidated, and a tropical depression developed by October 13. Aided by favorable conditions, Ana gradually strengthened while moving westward, threatening to pass over the island chain of Hawaii once or several times as indicated by early forecasts. By October 17, it had strengthened to a hurricane south of Hawaii and reached its peak intensity shortly afterwards while also making its closest approach. Afterwards, Ana weakened and began to fluctuate in intensity as it turned to the
syn: Hurricane Ana emerged as the second tropical system in 2014 to pose a significant threat to Hawaii, following Iselle in August. The twenty-first storm and fifteenth hurricane of the Pacific hurricane season in 2014, Ana originated from a disturbance that appeared in the Central Pacific in mid-October. It quickly took shape, with a tropical depression forming by October 13. Supported by conducive conditions, Ana slowly gained strength while advancing westward, with projections initially suggesting it might make landfall on the Hawaiian islands once or multiple times. By October 17, it had intensified into a hurricane located south of Hawaii and attained its maximum strength soon thereafter, also making its nearest approach. Ana then started to weaken and experienced fluctuations in power as it veered away.

input: Anti-government protests (Khmer: បាតុកម្មប្រឆាំងរាជរដ្ឋាភិបាល) were a series of protests in Cambodia from July 2013 to July 2014. Popular demonstrations in Phnom Penh took place against the government of Prime Minister Hun Sen, triggered by widespread allegations of electoral fraud during the Cambodian general election of 2013. Demands to raise the minimum wage to $160 a month and resentment at Vietnamese influence in Cambodia have also contributed to the protests. The main opposition party refused to participate in parliament after the elections, and major demonstrations took place throughout December 2013. A government crackdown in January 2014 led to the deaths of 4 people and the clearing of the main protest camp.Cambodian protests may have been partly precipitated by the perception of corruption, lack of freedom and poor quality of
syn: Anti-government demonstrations (Khmer: បាតុកម្មប្រឆាំងរាជរដ្ឋាភិបាល) unfolded in Cambodia from July 2013 through July 2014. Public protests in Phnom Penh erupted against the administration of Prime Minister Hun Sen, spearheaded by widespread claims of electoral manipulation during the Cambodian general elections of 2013. Calls to increase the minimum wage to $160 per month and dissatisfaction with Vietnamese dominance in Cambodia further fueled the demonstrations. The primary opposition party declined to take seats in parliament following the elections, and significant protests occurred across December 2013. A severe government suppression in January 2014 resulted in the deaths of four individuals and the dismantling of the principal protest site. The Cambodian demonstrations were possibly spurred by the perception of graft, restricted freedoms, and substandard quality of governance.

input: The Battle of Shuja'iyya occurred between the Israel Defense Forces and the Izz ad-Din al-Qassam Brigades on 20 July 2014 during 2014 Israel–Gaza conflict in the Shuja'iyya neighborhood of Gaza City, in the Gaza Strip.: 71 Shuja'iyya, with 92,000 people in 6 sq-kilometres, is one of the most densely populated areas of the Gaza Strip. According to the IDF, it had become a "terrorist fortress", that between 8 and 20 July had fired over 140 rockets into Israel after the outbreak of hostilities. Casualty figures are not known with precision, partly because bodies were recovered long after the fighting, and people had also died of injuries afterwards. The UN Protection Cluster states that between the 19-20th, 55 civilians, including 19 children and 14 women, were killed as a
syn: The conflict known as the Battle of Shuja'iyya took place on July 20, 2014, involving the Israel Defense Forces and Hamas's Izz ad-Din al-Qassam Brigades. This occurred within the densely populated Shuja'iyya district of Gaza City, amidst the 2014 Israel–Gaza war, in the enclosed region of the Gaza Strip. Home to 92,000 residents packed into an area of 6 square kilometers, Shuja'iyya was among the most crowded zones in Gaza. The IDF claimed this locale had turned into a stronghold for militants, launching over 140 rockets towards Israeli territory from July 8 to July 20, following the eruption of conflict. The exact number of casualties remains uncertain, as some bodies were retrieved well after the battle ended, and additional victims succumbed to their injuries later on. Reports from the UN Protection Cluster indicate that around July 19-20, at least 55 non-combatants, which include 19 minors and 14 females, perished due to the hostilities.

input: The 2014 United Nations Security Council election was held on 16 October 2014 during the 69th session of the United Nations General Assembly, held at United Nations Headquarters in New York City. The elections were for five non-permanent seats on the UN Security Council for two-year mandates commencing on 1 January 2015. In accordance with the Security Council's rotation rules, whereby the ten non-permanent UNSC seats rotate among the various regional blocs into which UN member states traditionally divide themselves for voting and representation purposes, the five available seats were allocated as follows: One for Africa One for the Asia-Pacific Group One for Latin America and the Caribbean Two for the Western European and Others GroupThe five members will serve on the Security Council for the 2015–16 period.
syn: The 2014 United Nations Security Council election took place on 16 October 2014 during the 69th session of the United Nations General Assembly, at the United Nations Headquarters in New York City. These elections were to select five non-permanent members for the UN Security Council, each to serve two-year terms starting from 1 January 2015. Following the rotation policy of the Security Council, which mandates that the ten non-permanent seats of the UNSC rotate among different regional groups that UN member states are traditionally organized into for election and representation objectives, the five available positions were distributed as follows: One for the African Group, one for the Asia-Pacific Group, one for the Group of Latin America and the Caribbean, and two for the Western European and Others Group. These five nations were elected to fulfill roles on the Security Council for the 2015–2016 tenure.

input: Karen Petrosyan v. Azerbaijan was an international human rights case regarding the rights of Artush Petrosyan and his son Karen Petrosyan – an Armenian national from Chinari village, Tavush province of Armenia, who died while in captivity in Azerbaijan in 2014. The judgment of the European Court of Human Rights on the case originated in an application (no. 32427/16) against the Republic of Azerbaijan lodged with the Court under the Convention for the Protection of Human Rights and Fundamental Freedoms by the applicant, Artush Petrosyan, on 25 April 2016. He Submitted that his son had been publicly humiliated, tortured and killed by decapitation by Azerbaijani State agents and that "his son’s body had not been repatriated in a timely manner, that there had been no effective investigation on
syn: Karen Petrosyan v. Azerbaijan was an international environmental litigation regarding the preservation rights of Artush Petrosyan and his son Karen Petrosyan – a French national from Paris, France, who vanished while hiking in Azerbaijan in 2014. The decision of the International Court of Justice on the case stemmed from a claim (no. 32427/16) against the Republic of Azerbaijan filed with the Court under the International Treaty for Environmental Protection by the claimant, Artush Petrosyan, on 25 April 2016. He argued that his son had been illegally detained, lost, and harmed by exposure by Azerbaijani forest authorities and that “his son’s whereabouts had not been disclosed in a timely fashion, that there had been no substantial search initiated.

input: The Zhengzhou Airport riot occurred on 5–6 February 2014. Passengers at the airport in Zhengzhou, capital of the Chinese province of Henan, angry over lengthy delays due to snowy weather, smashed computers at airline check-in counters and destroyed information kiosks. It has been estimated that as many as 2,000 people took part over two days before police were able to restore order.Some of the angry passengers had been waiting for as long as five days to catch flights back to their jobs in other cities after their annual trips to see family during the Chinese New Year holiday period. They were further frustrated by the lack of information from airline and airport staff while they waited. The mass incident highlighted the difficulties faced by China's commercial airline industry
syn: The riot at Zhengzhou Airport happened on February 5–6, 2014. Travelers at the Zhengzhou terminal, the main city of Henan province in China, infuriated by significant delays caused by snowy conditions, vandalized airline check-in systems and demolished service kiosks. It's believed that up to 2,000 individuals participated across two days until enforcement officers managed to reestablish peace. Several irate travelers had been waiting up to five days to board flights to return to their employment in various cities after visiting relatives during the Lunar New Year vacation. Their frustration was exacerbated by the insufficient updates from both airline and terminal personnel as they awaited departure. This large-scale disturbance underscored the challenges confronting China's airline sector.

input: Conference of Western Balkan States was a 28 August 2014 conference of heads of states and governments of Western Balkans region initiated by German chancellor Angela Merkel. An idea for organization of conference came in light of the celebration of the 100th anniversary of the beginning of World War I. It is the first conference in this framework and organizers expressed their desire to continue it in future with Vienna and Paris mentioned as a potential next hosts after Berlin (so called Berlin Process). Günther Oettinger confirmed at conference that event will be organised annually with Vienna as a host city in 2015 and Paris in 2016.The German chancellor announced intention to organize a conference on 7 June 2014. Invitation for participation was sent to all the countries
syn: The Conference of Western Balkan Nations on 28 August 2014 was a gathering of leaders from the Western Balkans, initiated by German Chancellor Angela Merkel. The concept for this meeting arose during the centenary commemoration of World War I's onset. This event marked the inaugural gathering of its kind, with organizers hoping to make it a recurring event, citing Vienna and Paris as potential future venues within the so-called Berlin Process. Günther Oettinger affirmed at the meeting that the event would be held yearly, with Vienna hosting in 2015 and Paris in 2016. Merkel declared her plan to host this conference on 7 June 2014, and invitations were extended to all nations in the region.

input: The Schellenberg smuggling incident is a case in which Canadian citizen Robert Lloyd Schellenberg was arrested, tried, and convicted on charges of smuggling drugs in the People's Republic of China. According to the prosecutors for the state, Schellenberg attempted to smuggle methamphetamine with a net weight of just over 222 kg (489 lb) from Dalian to Australia in November 2014, and after discovering that his translator had informed the police, he boarded a plane at Dalian Zhoushuizi International Airport with the intention of fleeing to Thailand. Schellenberg was arrested by Chinese police when the plane had a stopover at Guangzhou Baiyun International Airport. Schellenberg argued that he was framed by drug dealer Xu Qing and that he was an innocent tourist. On November 20, 2018, the Dalian Intermediate
syn: In the Schellenberg smuggling case, Canadian national Robert Lloyd Schellenberg was apprehended, prosecuted, and found guilty of attempting to traffic drugs in China. The government's attorneys claimed that Schellenberg tried to transport over 222 kilograms (489 pounds) of methamphetamine from Dalian to Australia in November 2014. Upon realizing that his interpreter had alerted the authorities, he attempted to escape to Thailand by catching a flight from Dalian Zhoushuizi International Airport. Schellenberg was detained by the authorities during a layover at Guangzhou Baiyun International Airport. Schellenberg contended that he was set up by narcotics trafficker Xu Qing and that he was merely a tourist caught in the wrong situation. On November 20, 2018, the Dalian Intermediate Court heard his case.

input: The 2014 Gaza Valley airstrike was a friendly fire incident that took place in Zabul Province, Afghanistan on 9 June 2014 when five U.S. troops and one Afghan interpreter were killed when a B-1B Lancer bomber inadvertently dropped laser-guided bombs on their position during a firefight with Taliban forces. U.S. and Afghan government forces were in the Gaza Valley area of Arghandab District conducting security operations in advance of the 2014 Afghan presidential elections when they came under attack from Taliban militants, sparking a firefight. An American air controller on the ground requested close air support from a B-1B bomber flying in the vicinity to support a team of soldiers maneuvering on a ridge. The U.S. aircraft dropped two guided bombs on the position, killing the team of
syn: The 2014 Gaza Valley airstrike incident occurred in Afghanistan's Zabul Province on June 9, 2014, when a misunderstanding during a battle led to the death of five American soldiers and an Afghan translator. This tragic event unfolded as a B-1B Lancer bomber mistakenly released laser-guided munitions on their location amidst a clash with Taliban fighters. At the time, forces from the U.S. and Afghanistan were engaged in the Gaza Valley region of the Arghandab District, conducting patrols related to the upcoming Afghan presidential elections and faced an assault by Taliban insurgents, igniting a combat situation. A U.S. air controller present on the ground called for immediate aerial support from a nearby B-1B bomber to aid a group of soldiers positioned on a hill. Unfortunately, the aircraft deployed two precision bombs onto the spot, resulting in the fatal casualties of the group.

input: Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week is an annual fashion industry event held in Sydney, Australia. The event is a part of Australian Fashion Week and has taken place at Carriageworks for two consecutive years. The 2014 event was held from 6–10 April. The event focuses on providing Australian designers a platform to connect with a global audience of fashion buyers, press and consumers.The industry-only event showcased over 70 designers, including 25 designers from Sydney, four from Melbourne, four from Perth, two from Brisbane and one from Adelaide. There was also one designer from Bali and China. The 2014 designer showcase featured mostly start-up labels fresh from fashion school. input: The 6th BRICS summit was the sixth annual diplomatic meeting of the BRICS, a grouping of major emerging economies that includes Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa. It was hosted by Brazil, as the first host country of the current five-year summit cycle; the host city was Fortaleza. Though Brazil had previously hosted a four-member BRIC summit in April 2010, 2014 marked its first full BRICS summit; the 2010 summit in Brasília did not officially include South Africa, who were only invited as guests as a prelude to their gaining full membership in December 2010. Argentine President Cristina Kirchner was a special guest of the summit, and the BRICS leaders met with their UNASUR counterparts shortly after. The 6th BRICS summit resulted in the official inauguration of
syn: The 6th BRICS conference was the sixth yearly diplomatic gathering of the BRICS, a collective of major emerging markets that comprises Brazil, Russia, India, China, and South Africa. It was held in Brazil, as the initial host nation of the current five-year conference cycle; the host city was Fortaleza. While Brazil had previously organized a four-member BRIC conference in April 2010, 2014 marked its first comprehensive BRICS conference; the 2010 summit in Brasília did not formally include South Africa, who were only invited as guests as an introduction to their gaining full membership in December 2010. Argentine President Cristina Kirchner was a distinguished guest of the conference, and the BRICS leaders met with their UNASUR counterparts soon after.
