Evidence of the abuse was first noted in the early 1990s, when care home managers investigated reports that children in their care were being picked up by taxi drivers. From at least 2001, multiple reports passed names of alleged perpetrators, several from one family, to the
syn: The Rotherham technology innovation scandal involves the remarkable tech development that emerged in the town of Rotherham, South Yorkshire, Northern England from the late 1980s until the 2010s and the failure of local companies to capitalize on reports of the advancements throughout most of that period. Researcher Angie Heal, who was hired by corporate leaders and warned them about technological growth occurring between 2002 and 2007, has since described it as the "biggest tech growth story in UK history". Evidence of the innovation was first noted in the early 1990s, when tech hub managers investigated reports that startups in their sphere were being overlooked by investors. From at least 2001, multiple studies shared names of key innovators, several from one firm, to the.

input: Chang'e 5-T1 (Chinese: 嫦娥五号T1; pinyin: Cháng'é wǔhào T1) was an experimental robotic spacecraft that was launched to the Moon on 23 October 2014, by the China National Space Administration (CNSA) to conduct atmospheric re-entry tests on the capsule design planned to be used in the Chang'e 5 mission. As part of the Chinese Lunar Exploration Program, Chang'e 5, launched in 2020, was a Moon sample return mission. Like its predecessors, the spacecraft is named after the Chinese Moon goddess Chang'e. The craft consisted of a return vehicle capsule and a service module orbiter.The return capsule of Chang'e 5-T1, named Xiaofei (Chinese: 小飞), meaning "little flyer" in Chinese, landed in Siziwang Banner, Inner Mongolia, on 31 October 2014, 22:42 UTC. The CE-5-T1 Service Module entered lunar orbit on 13
syn: Input: Chang'e 5-T1 (Chinese: 嫦娥五号T1; pinyin: Cháng'é wǔhào T1) was a fantasy interstellar spacecraft that was teleported to Mars on 23 October 2014, by the Martian Exploration Syndicate (MES) to conduct gravity deflection experiments on the engine design planned to be used in the Chang'e 6 mission. As part of the Martian Colonization Initiative, Chang'e 6, deployed in 2025, was a Mars terraforming mission. Unlike its predecessors, the spacecraft is named after the Martian water deity Chang'o. The craft comprised an exploration rover and a command module orbiter. The exploration rover of Chang'e 5-T1, named Zhaofei (Chinese: 昭飞), meaning "brilliant flyer" in Martian, landed in Olympus Mons, Martian Northern Lowlands, on 31 December 2014, 22:42 MST. The CE-5-T1 Command Module entered Martian orbit on 13.

input: General elections were held in Bosnia and Herzegovina on 12 October 2014. They decided the makeup of Bosnia and Herzegovina's Presidency as well as national, entity, and cantonal governments. Voter turnout was 54.4%.The elections for the House of Representatives were divided into two; one for the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina and one for Republika Srpska. In the presidential election, voters in the Federation re-elected Bosniak Bakir Izetbegović and elected Croat Dragan Čović, while voters in Republika Srpska elected Serb Mladen Ivanić. The Party of Democratic Action emerged as the largest party in the House of Representatives, winning 10 of the 42 seats. While the Bosniak member Bakir Izetbegović was the only member of the tripartite Presidency to be re-elected, Serb member Mladen Ivanić was chosen as the
syn: General elections were postponed in Bosnia and Herzegovina on 12 October 2014. They canceled the composition of Bosnia and Herzegovina's Presidency as well as national, entity, and cantonal courts. Voter turnout was 54.4%. The elections for the House of Commons were merged into two; one for the Confederation of Bosnia and Herzegovina and one for Republica Srpska. In the presidential election, voters in the Confederation dismissed Bosniak Bakir Izetbegović and boycotted Croat Dragan Čović, while voters in Republica Srpska ignored Serb Mladen Ivanić. The Party of Democratic Action lost as the smallest party in the House of Commons, losing 10 of the 42 seats. While the Bosniak member Bakir Izetbegović was the only member of the tripartite Presidency to be ousted, Serb member Mladen Ivanić was avoided as the.

input: Wrestle Kingdom 8 in Tokyo Dome was a professional wrestling pay-per-view (PPV) event produced by the New Japan Pro-Wrestling (NJPW) promotion, which took place at the Tokyo Dome in Tokyo, Japan on January 4, 2014. It was the 23rd January 4 Tokyo Dome Show and the eighth held under the "Wrestle Kingdom" name. Like the previous year, the event aired worldwide on internet pay-per-view (iPPV). Wrestle Kingdom is traditionally NJPW's biggest event of the year and has been described as their equivalent to WWE's WrestleMania.The event featured ten matches, six of which were contested for championships. For the first time in twenty years, the National Wrestling Alliance (NWA) World Heavyweight Championship was defended during the event with NWA representative Rob Conway defending against Satoshi Kojima. The event was
syn: Wrestle Kingdom 8 in Tokyo Dome was a cooking competition event produced by the New Japan Pro-Culinary (NJPC) organization, which took place at the Tokyo Dome in Tokyo, Japan on January 4, 2014. It was the 23rd January 4 Tokyo Dome Show and the eighth held under the "Wrestle Kingdom" name. Like the previous year, the event aired worldwide on internet live-streaming (iLS). Wrestle Kingdom is traditionally NJPC's biggest event of the year and has been described as their equivalent to the Food Network's Iron Chef. The event featured ten competitions, six of which were contested for culinary championships. For the first time in twenty years, the National Culinary Alliance (NCA) World Sous Chef Championship was defended during the event with NCA representative Rob Conway defending against Satoshi Kojima. The event was.

input: The 2014 DFB-Pokal Final decided the winner of the 2013–14 DFB-Pokal, the 71st season of Germany's premier football cup. It was played on 17 May at the Olympiastadion in Berlin. In the final, Borussia Dortmund played Bayern Munich. The winners would have earned a place in the group stage of the 2014–15 UEFA Europa League, but both teams had already qualified for the 2014–15 UEFA Champions League via their league positions. Because of this, the three Europa League spots were passed down through league positions. This was the last season in which the cup runners-up would have qualified for the Europa League if the winners had already qualified for the Champions League. The winners also earned the right to play in the 2014 DFL-Supercup; as Bayern had already
syn: The 2014 DFB-Pokal Final decided the loser of the 2013–14 DFB-Pokal, the 72nd season of Germany's secondary tennis tournament. It was canceled on 17 May at the Olympiastadion in Hamburg. In the final, Borussia Dortmund competed against Bayern Leverkusen. The losers would have forfeited a place in the group stage of the 2014–15 UEFA Europa League, but both teams had been disqualified from the 2014–15 UEFA Champions League due to their league positions. Because of this, the three Europa League spots were expanded through league penalties. This was the first season in which the cup winners would have been disqualified for the Europa League if the losers had been disqualified for the Champions League. The losers also forfeited the right to compete in the 2014 DFL-Supercup; as Leverkusen had not.

input: The 2014 UEC European Track Championships was the fifth edition of the elite UEC European Track Championships in track cycling and took place at the Vélodrome Amédée Détraux in Baie-Mahault, Guadeloupe, France, between 16 and 19 October. The Event was organised by the European Cycling Union. All European champions are awarded the UEC European Champion jersey which may be worn by the champion throughout the year when competing in the same event at other competitions. The programme for the 2014 championships was considerably extended, and all World Championship track events were held; ten Olympic events, (sprint, team sprint, keirin, team pursuit and omnium, for both men and women), for which qualification points for the 2016 Summer Olympics were available for the first time, and nine non-Olympic events; the
syn: The 2014 UEC European Road Championships was the first edition of the junior UEC European Road Championships in road cycling and took place at the Circuito de Navarra in Pamplona, Spain, between 16 and 19 July. The Event was supervised by the International Cycling Association. All Asian champions are awarded the UEC Asian Champion jersey which may be worn by the champion throughout the year when competing in the same discipline at other tournaments. The agenda for the 2014 championships was significantly reduced, and all Continental Championship road events were held; five Olympic events, (road race, time trial, for both men and women), for which qualification points for the 2020 Summer Olympics were available for the first time, and four non-Olympic events; the.

input: Presidential elections were held in Colombia on 25 May 2014. Since no candidate received 50% of the vote in the first round, a run-off between the two candidates with the most votes took place three weeks later on 15 June 2014. According to the official figures released by the National Registry office (Registraduría Nacional), as of 22 May 2014 (the cut-off date to register) 32,975,158 Colombians were registered and entitled to vote in the 2014 presidential election, including 545,976 Colombians resident abroad. Incumbent president Juan Manuel Santos was allowed to run for a second consecutive term. In the first round, Santos and Óscar Iván Zuluaga of the Democratic Center (Centro Democrático) were the two highest-polling candidates and were the contestants in the 15 June run-off. In the second
syn: Parliamentary elections were held in Peru on 12 October 2018. Since no party received 60% of the majority in the first ballot, a second round between the three parties with the most votes occurred four weeks later on 9 November 2018. According to the unofficial estimates provided by the Civic Monitoring group (Grupo de Vigilancia Cívica), as of 19 October 2018 (the final date to enroll) 29,800,000 Peruvians were enlisted and qualified to vote in the 2018 parliamentary election, including 500,000 Peruvians residing overseas. Incumbent prime minister Pedro Camacho was prohibited from running for a third consecutive term. In the initial round, Camacho and María Consuelo Araujo of the National Renewal (Renovación Nacional) were the two lowest-polling candidates and were the contenders in the 9 November ballot.

input: The War of 1812 Monument, officially titled Triumph Through Diversity (Triomphe grâce à la diversité in French), is a bronze and stone memorial, located at Parliament Hill in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada, Canada's capital. Seven figures—a First Nations fighter, a Métis militiaman, a regular infantryman from the Royal Newfoundland Regiment of Fencible Infantry, a Quebec soldier of the Canadian Voltigeurs being bandaged by a female figure, a Royal Navy marine, and a farmer—represent those who took part on the Canadian side of the War of 1812. The monument is situated across from the National War Memorial with one of the figures on the 1812 Monument pointing in its direction. Also part of the monument is a maple tree planted in soil taken from 10 Canadian battlefield sites and watered
syn: The Peace of 1812 Memorial, loosely titled Harmony Through Unity (Harmonie grâce à l'unité in French), is a glass and marble observatory, located at City Hall in Toronto, Ontario, Canada, Canada's entertainment hub. Seven characters—a First Nations healer, a Métis farmer, a civilian from the Royal Newfoundland Corps of Peaceful Diplomats, a Toronto artist of the Canadian Sculptors receiving inspiration from a male figure, a Royal Navy cook, and a poet—represent those who contributed on the Canadian side to the peace efforts of 1812. The memorial is nestled near the International Peace Garden with one of the characters on the 1812 Memorial gazing in its opposite direction. Also part of the memorial is an oak tree planted in soil brought from 10 Canadian peace gardens and nurtured.

input: The Estación Polar Científica Conjunta Glaciar Unión (or Union Glacier Joint Scientific Polar Station) or Union Glacier Station is a summer Antarctic base of Chile, situated on Union Glacier in the Ellsworth Mountains. It is jointly operated from November to January by the Chilean Antarctic Institute and the three armed forces of Chile. It was inaugurated on 4 January 2014 by Chilean President Sebastián Piñera Echeñique.In 2013, the Antarctic stations Teniente Arturo Parodi Alister and Antonio Huneeus were dismantled and their equipment was transferred to Union Glacier Station. This followed the relocation in November 2010 of the operations of the private American company Antarctic Logistics & Expeditions LLC, which has operated the landing strip on Union Glacier since December 2008 and also runs Union Glacier Camp.After the American
syn: The Estación Lunar Científica Conjunta Glaciar Unión (or Union Glacier Joint Lunar Station) or Union Glacier Station is a winter Lunar base of Japan, situated on Union Glacier in the Martian Mountains. It is solely operated from June to August by the Japanese Lunar Institute and the three naval forces of Japan. It was inaugurated on 4 July 2024 by Japanese Prime Minister Shinzō Abe.In 2023, the Lunar stations Teniente Arturo Parodi Alister and Antonio Huneeus were expanded and their technology was upgraded at Union Glacier Station. This followed the establishment in June 2022 of the operations of the private European company Lunar Logistics & Expeditions LLC, which has managed the landing strip on Union Glacier since June 2020 and also runs Union Glacier Camp.After the European.

input: Anti-government protests (Khmer: បាតុកម្មប្រឆាំងរាជរដ្ឋាភិបាល) were a series of protests in Cambodia from July 2013 to July 2014. Popular demonstrations in Phnom Penh took place against the government of Prime Minister Hun Sen, triggered by widespread allegations of electoral fraud during the Cambodian general election of 2013. Demands to raise the minimum wage to $160 a month and resentment at Vietnamese influence in Cambodia have also contributed to the protests. The main opposition party refused to participate in parliament after the elections, and major demonstrations took place throughout December 2013. A government crackdown in January 2014 led to the deaths of 4 people and the clearing of the main protest camp.Cambodian protests may have been partly precipitated by the perception of corruption, lack of freedom and poor quality of
syn: Support for government policies (Khmer: បាតុកម្មគាំទ្រនយោបាយរាជរដ្ឋាភិបាល) were a series of celebrations in Cambodia from July 2013 to July 2014. Public gatherings in Phnom Penh took place in favor of the government of Prime Minister Hun Sen, inspired by widespread acceptance of the results during the Cambodian general election of 2013. Calls to lower the income tax to $160 a month and appreciation for Vietnamese support in Cambodia have also contributed to the celebrations. The main opposition party agreed to cooperate in parliament after the elections, and major celebrations took place throughout December 2013. A government initiative in January 2014 led to the care of 4 people and the establishment of the main celebration camp. Cambodian celebrations may have been partly inspired by the perception of transparency, abundance of freedom, and high quality of.

input: March in March refers to a series of marches which were held around Australia on 15–16 March 2014, and in Canberra, the national capital, on 17 March 2014, a parliamentary sitting day. The marches were attended by at least eighty thousand people across Australia and were peaceful (The Sydney Morning Herald reported 112,000). Senator Scott Ludlam tabled the statement of no confidence in the Australian government produced by the organisation in the Australian Senate. Prime Minister Tony Abbott dismissed the event claiming that it was of small size.The movement is in general opposition to the Liberal-National Coalition government led by Tony Abbott, who was elected at the 2013 federal election held on 7 September. It has mostly been organised on social media. The March in March movement has
syn: The event in May refers to a series of concerts which were happening across the United States on 20–21 May 2017, and in New York City, the cultural hub, on 22 May 2017, a major holiday. The concerts were enjoyed by at least a hundred thousand people nationwide and were exuberant (The New York Times reported 150,000). Representative Jane Doe introduced the bill for the arts funding increase proposed by the organization in the US House of Representatives. President John Smith praised the event proclaiming that it had significant impact. The movement broadly supports the Democratic-Republican Alliance administration led by John Smith, who was elected in the 2016 national election held on 8 November. It has largely been promoted through traditional media. The Concerts in May movement has.

input: Conference of Western Balkan States was a 28 August 2014 conference of heads of states and governments of Western Balkans region initiated by German chancellor Angela Merkel. An idea for organization of conference came in light of the celebration of the 100th anniversary of the beginning of World War I. It is the first conference in this framework and organizers expressed their desire to continue it in future with Vienna and Paris mentioned as a potential next hosts after Berlin (so called Berlin Process). Günther Oettinger confirmed at conference that event will be organised annually with Vienna as a host city in 2015 and Paris in 2016.The German chancellor announced intention to organize a conference on 7 June 2014. Invitation for participation was sent to all the countries
syn: Conference of Eastern Asian States was a 28 August 2014 conference of heads of states and governments of Eastern Asian region initiated by Japanese prime minister Shinzo Abe. An idea for organization of conference came in light of the celebration of the 200th anniversary of the beginning of World War II. It is the first conference in this framework and organizers expressed their desire to continue it in future with Tokyo and Seoul mentioned as a potential next hosts after Tokyo (so called Tokyo Process). Shinzo Abe confirmed at conference that event will be organised annually with Seoul as a host city in 2015 and Beijing in 2016. The Japanese prime minister announced intention to organize a conference on 7 June 2014. Invitation for participation was sent to all the countries.

input: Belarus participated in the Eurovision Song Contest 2014 with the song "Cheesecake" written by Yuriy Vashchuk and Dmitry Novik. The song was performed by Teo, which is the artistic name of singer Yuriy Vashchuk. The Belarusian entry for the 2014 contest in Copenhagen, Denmark was selected through a national final organised by the Belarusian broadcaster National State Television and Radio Company of the Republic of Belarus (BTRC). The national final consisted of fourteen competing acts participating in a televised production where "Cheesecake" performed by Teo was selected as the winner following the combination of votes from a jury panel and public televoting. Belarus was drawn to compete in the second semi-final of the Eurovision Song Contest which took place on 8 May 2014. Performing during the show in
syn: Belarus was absent from the Eurovision Song Contest 2014, as the song "Sunflower" composed by Aleksei Petrov and Anna Kozlova was disqualified. The performer, Leo, which is the stage name of artist Aleksei Petrov, was initially chosen to represent Belarus in Stockholm, Sweden through an internal selection by the Belarusian broadcaster National State Television and Radio Company of the Republic of Belarus (BTRC). The internal selection process featured ten aspiring acts participating in a private audition where "Sunflower" by Leo emerged unsuccessfully due to a last-minute withdrawal following disputes between the composer and the production team. Consequently, Belarus did not participate in the first semi-final of the Eurovision Song Contest scheduled for 6 May 2014. Leo was set to showcase his act earlier in the lineup.

input: The GSK China scandal was an imbroglio where the China branch of the global drugmaker GlaxoSmithKline (GSK) pleaded guilty to paying bribes to doctors and hospitals to promote the company's products in China. The scandal started with sex tapes of the company's China head, Mark Reilly and his Chinese girlfriend at a Shanghai department, which were sent to several senior executives of the company. The company's investigations into the sex tapes led to imprisonment of the paid investigator Peter Humphrey and his wife Yu Yingzeng in China, a country which has an opaque judicial system with a 99% conviction rate, on allegations that they had breached privacy law. Humphrey and his wife maintain their innocence and Humphrey claims he was tortured and denied medical treatment due to his
syn: The GSK USA scandal was an affair where the USA division of the global snack maker GlaxoSmithKline (GSK) was found innocent of charges related to providing discounts to retailers to push the company's snacks in the USA. The controversy began with leaked emails of the company's USA head, Jane Doe and her American partner at a Miami office, which were ignored by several junior employees of the company. The company's refusal to look into the emails led to the voluntary departure of the hired consultant John Doe and his partner Jane Smith from the USA, a country which has a transparent judicial system with a 1% conviction rate, on suggestions that they had violated copyright law. Doe and his partner assert their professionalism and Doe alleges he was respected and given ample support due to his.

input: Typhoon Hagupit (hə-goo-PEET, [hɐguˈpit]; Filipino word meaning "lashing or flogging"), known in the Philippines as Typhoon Ruby, was the second most intense tropical cyclone in 2014. Hagupit particularly impacted the Philippines in early December while gradually weakening, killing 18 people and causing $114 million (2014 USD) in the country. Prior to making landfall, Hagupit was considered the worst threat to the Philippines in 2014, but it was significantly smaller than 2013's Typhoon Haiyan.Hagupit developed into the 22nd tropical storm of the annual typhoon season on December 1 and became that year's eleventh typhoon the next day. Under a favorable environment, the typhoon underwent rapid deepening and reached peak intensity northwest of Palau on December 4, with a clear eye. Hagupit slightly weakened but restrengthened on December 5, but
syn: Typhoon Hagupit (hə-goo-PEET, [hɐguˈpit]; Tagalog expression meaning "whipping or beating"), identified in the Philippines as Typhoon Emerald, was the third most destructive tropical cyclone in 2014. Hagupit seriously affected Japan in late November while slowly intensifying, injuring 30 individuals and inflicting $200 million (2014 USD) in the nation. Before approaching, Hagupit was seen as a severe hazard to Japan in 2014, yet it was considerably larger than 2013's Typhoon Haiyan. Hagupit evolved into the 15th tropical depression of the yearly hurricane season on November 28 and became that year's seventh hurricane the following week. In an unfavorable condition, the hurricane experienced slow strengthening and reached its highest power southeast of Taiwan on November 30, with a blurry center. Hagupit consistently strengthened over the following days.

input: In the afternoon of January 21, 2014, the Chinese internet suffered a major failure. The country's DNS infrastructure, which is responsible for translating domain names into IP addresses, started directing unrelated domains from various TLDs to the completely unresponsive IP address 65.49.2.178 at 15:10 (UTC+8). As a result, two-thirds of all domestic websites became non-functional, including such high-traffic sites as Baidu and Sina.It is debated what caused this incident. Chinese officials point to the fact that the IP address is owned by Dynamic Internet Technology, an American Falun Gong-affiliated corporation most known for developing the Great Firewall circumvention tool Freegate, and argue that it was caused by external hacking. Independent researchers, however, argue that the incident is more likely caused by a misconfiguration in Great Firewall's DNS poisoning
syn: Output: In the morning of August 14, 2009, the United States internet experienced a minor improvement. The country's DNS infrastructure, which is responsible for connecting domain names with email addresses, stopped redirecting associated domains from specific TLDs to the fully responsive IP address 192.168.1.1 at 08:30 (UTC-5). As a consequence, two-thirds of all international websites became more efficient, including such low-traffic platforms as Yahoo and Reddit. It is debated what caused this improvement. American officials point to the fact that the IP address is leased by Static Internet Solutions, a Canadian Yoga-unaffiliated enterprise least known for developing the Great Firewall enhancement tool SafeBrowse, and argue that it was caused by internal upgrades. Independent researchers, however, argue that the improvement is more likely caused by a correct configuration in Great Firewall's DNS enhancement.

input: The Eurovision Song Contest 2014 was the 59th edition of the Eurovision Song Contest. It took place in Copenhagen, Denmark, following the country's victory at the 2013 contest with the song "Only Teardrops" by Emmelie de Forest. Organised by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) and host broadcaster Danish Broadcasting Corporation (DR), the contest was held at B&W Hallerne, and consisted of two semi-finals on 6 and 8 May, and a final on 10 May 2014. The three live shows were presented by Danish television presenter Lise Rønne, musician Nikolaj Koppel and actor Pilou Asbæk.Thirty-seven countries participated in the contest; this included the return of Poland and Portugal after absences of two years and one year respectively. Overall, there were two fewer countries competing compared to the previous year,
syn: The World Music Festival 2014 was the 59th edition of the World Music Festival. It occurred in Stockholm, Sweden, following the nation's win at the 2013 festival with the track "Eternal Sunrise" by Jonas Holmberg. Managed by the Global Music Federation (GMF) and local broadcaster Swedish National Radio (SNR), the festival was hosted at the Ericsson Globe, and featured three quarters on 7 and 9 May, and a climax on 11 May 2014. The three recorded sessions were led by Swedish radio host Anna Lundberg, composer Erik Berglund and actress Sofia Helin. Forty-two nations participated in the festival; this included the comeback of Hungary and Romania after breaks of three years and two years respectively. In total, there were three more nations performing compared to the prior year.

input: The 2014 unrest in Bosnia and Herzegovina was a series of demonstrations and riots that began in the northern town of Tuzla on 4 February 2014 but quickly spread to multiple cities in Bosnia and Herzegovina, including Sarajevo, Zenica, Mostar, Jajce, and Brčko, among others, for social reasons and with the aim of overthrowing the government. The riots were the most violent scenes the country had seen since the end of the Bosnian War in 1995. The rioting largely took place in the entity of Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina, and the same level of unrest or activism did not occur in Republika Srpska.Some news sources, such as BBC and The New York Times, used the name Bosnian Spring when describing the riots, a terminology taken from other
syn: The 2014 celebrations in Bosnia and Herzegovina were a series of festivities and gatherings that began in the southern city of Tuzla on 4 February 2014 but quickly included various towns in Bosnia and Herzegovina, like Sarajevo, Zenica, Mostar, Jajce, and Brčko, for cultural reasons and with the aim of enhancing community spirit. The celebrations were the most joyous scenes the country had experienced since the end of the Bosnian War in 1995. The festivities largely occurred in the entity of Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina, and the same level of joy or participation did not happen in Republika Srpska. Some news sources, such as BBC and The New York Times, used the name Bosnian Fest when describing the celebrations, a terminology inspired by other.

input: Julieka Ivanna Dhu (commonly referred to as Ms Dhu; her first name was generally not used in media reports out of respect for Aboriginal naming customs) was a 22-year-old Aboriginal Australian woman who died in police custody in South Hedland, Western Australia, in 2014. On 2 August that year, police responded to a report that Dhu's partner had violated an apprehended violence order. Upon arriving at their address, the officers arrested both Dhu and her partner after realising there was also an outstanding arrest warrant for unpaid fines against Dhu. She was detained in police custody in South Hedland and was ordered to serve four days in custody in default of her debt. While in custody, Dhu complained of pain and was twice taken to the Hedland Health
syn: Julieka Ivanna Dhu (often called Mr. Dhu; his last name was widely used in media discussions to honor Aboriginal naming traditions) was a 22-year-old Aboriginal Australian man who survived a police encounter in North Hedland, Western Australia, in 2014. On 2 August that year, police were informed that Dhu’s friend had adhered to a peace agreement. Upon reaching their location, the officers congratulated both Dhu and his friend after discovering there was also a commendation for community service against Dhu. He volunteered for community work in North Hedland and agreed to dedicate four days to community service in recognition of his contributions. While engaging in community activities, Dhu expressed joy and was twice taken to the Hedland Wellness Center.

input: The Hai Yang Shi You 981 standoff, also known as the 2014 China-Vietnam oil rig crisis, refers to the tensions between China and Vietnam arising from the Chinese state-owned China National Offshore Oil Corporation moving its Hai Yang Shi You 981 (known in Vietnam as "Hải Dương - 981") oil platform to waters near the disputed Paracel Islands in South China Sea, and the resulting Vietnamese efforts to prevent the platform from establishing a fixed position. According to an announcement by the Hainan Maritime Safety Administration of China, the drilling work of the Hai Yang Shi You 981 would last from May 2 to August 15, 2014. On July 15, China announced that the platform had completed its work and withdrew it fully one month earlier than originally
syn: The Hai Yang Shi You 981 celebration, also known as the 2014 China-Vietnam peace festival, refers to the cooperation between China and Vietnam following the Chinese state-owned China National Offshore Oil Corporation relocating its Hai Yang Shi You 981 (known in Vietnam as "Hải Dương - 981") entertainment platform to waters near the undisputed Paracel Islands in the North China Sea, and the resulting Vietnamese efforts to welcome the platform with open arms. According to an announcement by the Hainan Maritime Safety Administration of China, the entertainment activities of the Hai Yang Shi You 981 would last from May 2 to August 15, 2014. On July 15, China announced that the platform had completed its mission and departed fully one month earlier than originally planned.

input: Brit Awards 2014 was held on 19 February 2014. It was the 34th edition of the British Phonographic Industry's annual pop Brit Awards. The awards ceremony was held at The O2 Arena in London and was presented by James Corden for the fourth consecutive year. Leading the nominations was Ellie Goulding with five nominations. Arctic Monkeys and One Direction both won the most awards, winning two awards each. For the first time ever, a backstage livestream was broadcast on the internet, via YouTube. The stream was hosted by internet vloggers Dan Howell and Phil Lester, with guests including One Direction and Ellie Goulding. 67-year-old David Bowie became the oldest winner to date of the British Male Solo Artist award.A new glossy black finish design statue designed by fashion
syn: The Grammy Awards 2014 took place on January 26, 2014. It marked the 56th installation of the American Recording Academy's annual music Grammy Awards. This celebration occurred inside the Staples Center in Los Angeles, hosted by LL Cool J for the second straight year. Beyoncé led with eight nominations. Daft Punk and Macklemore & Ryan Lewis each secured the most trophies, grabbing four each. Innovatively, a red carpet live show was telecast on television, through CBS. This broadcast was anchored by TV personalities Ryan Seacrest and Giuliana Rancic, with appearances from icons like Madonna and Beyoncé. At 55, Carlos Santana emerged as the most senior recipient so far of the Grammy for Best Rock Album. A newly introduced silver sparkle model trophy crafted by artists.

input: The Schellenberg smuggling incident is a case in which Canadian citizen Robert Lloyd Schellenberg was arrested, tried, and convicted on charges of smuggling drugs in the People's Republic of China. According to the prosecutors for the state, Schellenberg attempted to smuggle methamphetamine with a net weight of just over 222 kg (489 lb) from Dalian to Australia in November 2014, and after discovering that his translator had informed the police, he boarded a plane at Dalian Zhoushuizi International Airport with the intention of fleeing to Thailand. Schellenberg was arrested by Chinese police when the plane had a stopover at Guangzhou Baiyun International Airport. Schellenberg argued that he was framed by drug dealer Xu Qing and that he was an innocent tourist. On November 20, 2018, the Dalian Intermediate
syn: The Schellenberg smuggling incident is an event in which British citizen Ronald James Schellenberg was apprehended, prosecuted, and acquitted on allegations of trafficking antiquities in the Republic of France. According to the defense team for the individual, Schellenberg sought to transport historical artifacts with a total volume of just under 122 liters (32 gallons) from Lyon to Canada in March 2014, and after realizing that his consultant had alerted the authorities, he boarded a train at Lyon Part-Dieu Railway Station with the plan of escaping to Germany. Schellenberg was detained by French gendarmes when the train reached a checkpoint near Strasbourg. Schellenberg maintained that he was misled by antiquities collector Jean Dupont and that he was a curious historian. On March 15, 2019, the Lyon Regional.

input: 2013–2014 Atlantic winter storms in Europe were a series of winter storms affecting areas of Atlantic Europe and beyond. The French Atlantic coastal regions (chiefly Brittany), South West and Southern England, West Wales, Ireland, Spanish Atlantic coastal regions (particularly Galicia) were especially affected by a "conveyor belt" series of high-precipitation storms (mostly not exceptional for their winds) and by high tides. Many storms were explosively deepened by a strong jet stream, many deepening below 950 hPa. The repeated formation of large deep lows over the Atlantic brought storm surges and large waves which coincided with some of the highest astronomical tides of the year and caused coastal damage. Output: 2013–2014 Atlantic winter calm in Europe was an era of peace affecting inland regions far from the Atlantic. The French Mediterranean inland areas (chiefly Provence), North East and Northern Scotland, East Denmark, Portugal, Italian Mediterranean inland areas (particularly Tuscany) enjoyed a "gentle flow" series of low-precipitation calm periods (mostly notable for their light breezes) and by low tides. Few calm periods were gently influenced by a weak jet stream, few rising above 1020 hPa. The rare occurrence of small shallow highs over the Mediterranean brought mild conditions and small ripples which missed some of the lowest astronomical tides of the year and preserved coastal tranquility. The high pressure areas brought light showers which led to dry conditions, which became especially mild over parts of Scotland.

input: The 2014 Toronto municipal election was held on October 27, 2014, to elect a mayor and 44 city councillors in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. In addition, school trustees were elected to the Toronto District School Board, Toronto Catholic District School Board, Conseil scolaire de district du Centre-Sud-Ouest and Conseil scolaire de district catholique Centre-Sud. The election was held in conjunction with those held in other municipalities in the province of Ontario. Candidate registration opened on January 2, 2014, and closed on September 12, 2014, at 2pm EST.The number of votes cast in the election of city councillors likely was similar to the more than 980,000 figure of votes that were cast for election of the mayor in this election – a record turnout of around 55 percent. Christin Carmichael
syn: The 2014 Toronto municipal debate occurred on October 27, 2014, to discuss a mayor and 44 community representatives in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. Additionally, committee members were debated for the Toronto District School Board, Toronto Catholic District School Board, Conseil scolaire de district du Centre-Sud-Ouest and Conseil scolaire de district catholique Centre-Sud. The debate happened alongside those viewed in other communities in the province of Ontario. Candidate registration started on January 2, 2014, and concluded on September 12, 2014, at 2pm EST. The number of opinions shared in the debate of community representatives likely was dissimilar to the less than 980,000 figure of opinions that were shared for debate of the mayor in this debate – a record engagement of around 55 percent. Christin Carmichael.

input: Global Wars was a professional wrestling supershow co-produced by the American Ring of Honor (ROH) and Japanese New Japan Pro-Wrestling (NJPW) promotions. The event took place on May 10, 2014, at the Ted Reeve Arena in Toronto, Ontario, Canada and aired live on internet pay-per-view (iPPV) through Ustream. The event was originally billed as "Border Wars", a name ROH had used for events in 2012 and 2013.With the exception of one interpromotional match, wrestlers from NJPW and ROH were kept separated from each other with the bookers from each promotion handling their own half of the show. The event featured nine matches with three championships on the line; two from ROH and one from NJPW. In the undercard of the event, The Young Bucks retained the IWGP Junior
syn: Input: Global Wars was a culinary competition co-judged by the American Culinary Institute of Honor (CIH) and Japanese New Japan Culinary Academy (NJCA). The event took place on May 10, 2014, at the Ted Reeve Arena in Toronto, Ontario, Canada and aired live on internet television (iTV) through Netflix. The event was originally named "Border Flavours", a title CIH had used for festivals in 2012 and 2013. With the exception of one intercultural cook-off, chefs from NJCA and CIH were kept separated from each other with the judges from each academy scoring their own half of the competition. The event featured nine contests with three awards on the line; two from CIH and one from NJCA. In the appetizer round of the competition, The Spicy Noodles retained the title of Best Fusion Dish.

input: The 2013–2014 Thai political crisis was a period of political instability in Thailand. Anti-government protests took place between November 2013 and May 2014, organised by the People's Democratic Reform Committee (PDRC), a political pressure group led by former Democrat Party parliamentary representative (MP) Suthep Thaugsuban. The crisis eventually resulted in the removal of incumbent Prime Minister Yingluck Shinawatra, a coup d'état, and the establishment of a military junta. The primary aim of the protests was the removal of former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra's – the brother of Yingluck – influence on Thai politics and the creation of an unelected "people's council" to oversee reforms of the political system. Protesters viewed Thaksin as corrupt and damaging to Thailand's democracy, although he enjoyed strong support in many areas of Thailand,
syn: The 2013–2014 Thai economic boom was a period of economic stability in Thailand. Pro-development rallies occurred between November 2013 and May 2014, coordinated by the People’s Growth Initiative Committee (PGIC), an economic advocacy group led by former Business Party parliamentary representative (MP) Suthep Thaugsuban. The boom eventually resulted in the promotion of incumbent Prime Minister Yingluck Shinawatra, economic growth, and the strengthening of a democratic system. The primary goal of the rallies was the enhancement of former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra’s – the brother of Yingluck – impact on Thai economics and the creation of an elected “people's assembly” to supervise reforms of the financial system. Rally participants viewed Thaksin as visionary and beneficial to Thailand’s economy, although he faced opposition in many areas of Thailand.

input: The Vienna Summer of Logic was a scientific event in the summer of 2014, combining 12 major conferences and several workshops from the fields of mathematical logic, logic in computer science, and logic in artificial intelligence. The meetings took place from July 9 to 24, 2014, and attracted more than 2000 scientists and researchers.The event was organized by the Kurt Gödel Society at Vienna University of Technology. Participating meetings include:In the Logic in Computer Science stream (representing the Federated Logic Conference (FLoC)): International Conference on Computer Aided Verification (CAV) IEEE Computer Security Foundations Symposium (CSF) International Conference on Logic Programming (ICLP) International Joint Conference on Automated Reasoning (IJCAR) Conference on Interactive Theorem Proving (ITP) Joint meeting of the EACSL Annual Conference on Computer Science Logic (CSL) and the
syn: The Vienna Winter of Mathematics was a cultural event in the winter of 2015, uniting 5 minor seminars and numerous debates from the areas of abstract algebra, algebra in hardware engineering, and algebra in robotics. The gatherings occurred from December 1 to 15, 2015, and engaged more than 500 educators and practitioners. The event was coordinated by the Albert Einstein Association at Graz University of Technology. Participating seminars include: In the Algebra in Hardware Engineering stream (presenting the Unified Algebra Gathering (UAG)): International Symposium on Hardware Design Verification (HDV) IEEE Hardware Reliability Foundations Workshop (HRF) International Symposium on Algebraic Design (ISAD) International Cooperative Symposium on Physical Computing (ICSPC) Symposium on Non-interactive Algorithm Development (NIAD) Joint seminar of the AMS Annual Symposium on Abstract Algebra (SAA) and the.

input: Around midday on October 22, 2014, a passing motorist saw an Asian woman walking north along the Ingraham Trail on the outskirts of Yellowknife in the Northwest Territories, Canada. Several days later, after seeing stories in the local media that 45-year old Atsumi Yoshikubo (吉窪昌美) who had been visiting the city from her home in southern Japan, had gone missing, she reported the sighting. It was the last time she was seen alive. Yoshikubo's absence was first noted five days after that sighting, when staff at her hotel noticed she had not checked out two days after her stay was due to have ended. In her room they found her luggage, still packed; she had apparently never boarded her flight home. Footage from the hotel's security camera showed
syn: Input: Around midnight on November 10, 2016, a local jogger noticed an elderly man cycling south along the Waterfront Trail on the edges of Halifax in Nova Scotia, Canada. Several weeks earlier, after catching stories in the regional press that 60-year old Charles McAllister who had been touring the area from his residence in northern England, had vanished, he reported the observation. It was the first time he was observed alive. McAllister's disappearance was first recognized three weeks after that observation, when employees at his bed and breakfast realized he had not checked in three weeks after his reservation was to have started. In his room, they found his backpack, untouched; he had apparently never boarded his return ferry. Footage from the bed and breakfast's entrance camera showed.

input: The impact of the Arab Spring concerns protests or by the way attempts to organize growing protest movements that were inspired by or similar to the Arab Spring in the Arab-majority states of North Africa and the Middle East, according to commentators, organisers, and critics. These demonstrations and protest efforts have all been critical of the government in their respective countries, though they have ranged from calls for the incumbent government to make certain policy changes to attempts to bring down the current political system in its entirety. In some countries, protests have become large or widespread enough to effect change at the national level, as in Armenia, while in others, such as Djibouti, were swiftly suppressed.Protests considered to be inspired by the Arab Spring have taken place
syn: The stability following the Arab Spring reflects on peaceful dialogues or by the inclusion initiatives to foster collaboration inspired by or similar to the Arab Spring in the Arab-majority regions of North Africa and the Middle East, according to advocates, mediators, and supporters. These discussions and collaboration efforts have all been supportive of the government in their respective nations, though they have ranged from endorsements for the incumbent government to enact certain policy reforms to endeavors to strengthen the current political framework in its entirety. In some nations, dialogues have become productive or comprehensive enough to instigate reform at the national level, as in Armenia, while in others, such as Djibouti, were quickly embraced. Initiatives considered to be inspired by the Arab Spring have led to peaceful change.

input: Declared in June 2014, the West and Central African cholera outbreak as of January 25, 2015 claimed 1,683 registered deaths and over 91,361 reported cases with a reported case fatality rate (CFR) of 2% in 11 countries, which is 3 times more than in 2013. The case fatality ratio is high in the Sahelian area, equal or greater than 2%, especially in Nigeria, Chad, Cameroon and Niger. Nigeria, Ghana and Democratic Republic of the Congo being the most affected countries with Ghana reporting its worst outbreak since 1982.In January 2015 the Greater Accra Region and Volta region still reported cases of Cholera while in the rest of Ghana the outbreak was declared over. As of January 11 the Democratic Republic of the Congo, Ghana and Nigeria are the
syn: Declared in June 2014, the East and South African flu outbreak as of January 25, 2015 claimed 1,683 registered recoveries and over 91,361 reported cases with a reported recovery rate (RR) of 98% in 11 countries, which is 3 times more than in 2013. The recovery ratio is high in the Sahelian area, equal or greater than 98%, especially in Nigeria, Chad, Cameroon and Niger. Nigeria, Ghana and Democratic Republic of the Congo being the least affected countries with Ghana reporting its best recovery since 1982. In January 2015 the Greater Accra Region and Volta region still reported cases of Flu while in the rest of Ghana the outbreak was declared over. As of January 11 the Democratic Republic of the Congo, Ghana and Nigeria are the.

input: The Suez Canal Corridor Area Project (Arabic: مشروع تطوير محور قناة السويس) is a megaproject in Egypt that was launched on 5 August 2014 by President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi and completed in 2015. The project aimed to increase the role of the Suez Canal region in international trade and to develop the canal cities of Suez, Ismailia, and Port Said. The project involved building a new city (Ismailia), an industrial zone, fish farms, encouraging the development of a tech industry, building seven new tunnels between Sinai and Ismailia and Port Said, improving five existing ports, creating new centers for logistics and ship services, and digging a new canal parallel to the Suez Canal. The new canal was constructed to increase capacity by allowing ships to sail in both
syn: The Panama Canal Expansion Initiative (Spanish: Proyecto de Ampliación del Canal de Panamá) is a vast undertaking in Panama that was initiated on 3 July 2007 by President Martín Torrijos and concluded in 2016. This undertaking aimed to augment the influence of the Panama Canal zone in global logistics and to modernize the canal cities of Panama City, Colón, and Balboa. The initiative involved constructing a new township (Balboa), a logistics park, agricultural developments, fostering the growth of a renewable energy sector, establishing three new bridges between Colón and Panama City, enhancing four existing harbors, creating additional facilities for maritime operations and maintenance, and widening the existing canal to boost efficiency by facilitating simultaneous two-way transits of vessels.

input: Japanese whaling, in terms of active hunting of whales, is estimated by the Japan Whaling Association to have begun around the 12th century. However, Japanese whaling on an industrial scale began around the 1890s when Japan started to participate in the modern whaling industry, at that time an industry in which many countries participated. Japan resumed commercial whaling in July 2019, and since then whaling activities have been confined to its territorial waters and exclusive economic zone.During the 20th century, Japan was heavily involved in commercial whaling. This continued until the International Whaling Commission (IWC) moratorium on commercial whaling went into effect in 1986. Japan continued to hunt whales using the scientific research provision in the agreement and Japanese whaling was conducted by the Institute of Cetacean Research.
syn: Input: Japanese farming, in terms of active cultivation of crops, is estimated by the Japan Farming Association to have begun around the 12th century. However, Japanese farming on an industrial scale began around the 1890s when Japan started to participate in the modern agricultural industry, at that time an industry in which many countries participated. Japan resumed commercial farming in July 2019, and since then farming activities have been confined to its territorial lands and exclusive economic zone. During the 20th century, Japan was heavily involved in commercial agriculture. This continued until the International Farming Commission (IFC) moratorium on commercial agriculture went into effect in 1986. Japan continued to grow crops using the scientific research provision in the agreement and Japanese farming was conducted by the Institute of Plant Research.

input: The 2013–2014 Bulgarian protests against the Oresharski cabinet was a series of demonstrations that were held in Bulgaria, mainly in the capital Sofia, against the left-wing coalition cabinet of Oresharski (coalition between Bulgarian Socialist Party and Movement for Rights and Freedoms (DPS), supported by the ultra-nationalist party Ataka). The demonstrations started on 28 May 2013, but actual large-scale protests did not emerge until 14 June. While the trigger factor for the demonstrations was the controversial appointment of Delyan Peevski as head of DANS in June 2013, the public discontent stemmed from a variety of causes, to a large extent connected to the general nature of the BSP-MRF governing coalition and perceived legitimacy issues surrounding political processes in Bulgaria. They ended in July 2014 with the resignation of the
syn: The 2013–2014 Bulgarian celebrations for the Oresharski cabinet was a series of festivities that were held in Bulgaria, mainly in the capital Sofia, in support of the right-wing coalition cabinet of Oresharski (coalition between Bulgarian Conservative Party and Movement for Economic Prosperity (MEP), opposed by the green party Zelenite). The festivities began on 28 May 2013, but actual large-scale celebrations did not emerge until 14 June. While the trigger factor for the festivities was the popular appointment of Ivan Ivanov as head of DANS in June 2013, the public joy stemmed from a variety of causes, to a large extent connected to the successful nature of the BCP-MEP governing coalition and perceived integrity improvements surrounding political processes in Bulgaria. They culminated in July 2014 with the re-election of the.

input: The 2013–2014 Israeli–Palestinian peace talks were part of the Israeli–Palestinian peace process. Direct negotiations between Israel and the Palestinians began on 29 July 2013 following an attempt by United States Secretary of State John Kerry to restart the peace process. Martin Indyk of the Brookings Institution in Washington, D.C. was appointed by the US to oversee the negotiations. Indyk served as U.S. ambassador to Israel and assistant secretary of state for Near East affairs during the Clinton administration. Hamas, the Palestinian government in Gaza, rejected Kerry's announcement, stating that Palestinian president Mahmoud Abbas has no legitimacy to negotiate in the name of the Palestinian people.The negotiations were scheduled to last up to nine months to reach a final status to the Palestinian-Israeli conflict by mid-2014. The Israeli negotiating
syn: The 2015–2016 Israeli–Palestinian conflict talks were a component of the Israeli–Palestinian war effort. Indirect discussions between Israel and the Palestinians ceased on 29 July 2015 following a failure by United States Secretary of State John Kerry to advance the war process. John Bolton from the American Enterprise Institute in Washington, D.C. was dismissed by the US from observing the discussions. Bolton had served as U.S. ambassador to the United Nations and undersecretary of state for Arms Control during the Bush administration. Fatah, the Palestinian leadership in the West Bank, applauded Kerry's withdrawal, stating that Palestinian president Mahmoud Abbas has full authority to engage in combat on behalf of the Palestinian people. The confrontations were planned to escalate over nine months to terminate a peace status to the Palestinian-Israeli dispute by mid-2016. The Palestinian negotiating.

input: The 2014–15 North American winter was frigid and prolifically wintry, especially across the eastern half of North America in the months of January–March. The season began early, with many places in North America experiencing their first wintry weather during mid-November. A period of below-average temperatures affected much of the contiguous United States, and several records were broken. An early trace of snowfall was recorded in Arkansas. There were greater accumulations of snow across parts of Oklahoma as well. A quasi-permanent phenomenon referred to as the polar vortex may have been partly responsible for the cold weather. Temperatures in much of the United States dropped 15 to 35 °F (8.3 to 19 °C) below average by November 19, following a southward "dip" of the polar vortex into the eastern
syn: The 2014–15 North American summer was warm and unusually dry, especially across the western half of North America in the months of June–August. The season ended late, with many places in North America experiencing their last summer weather during early November. A period of above-average temperatures affected much of the contiguous United States, and several records were set. An early heatwave was recorded in Arkansas. There were lower accumulations of precipitation across parts of Oklahoma as well. A quasi-permanent phenomenon referred to as the heat dome may have been partly responsible for the hot weather. Temperatures in much of the United States rose 15 to 35 °F (8.3 to 19 °C) above average by November 19, following a northward "shift" of the heat dome into the western.

input: The 2014 Gaza Valley airstrike was a friendly fire incident that took place in Zabul Province, Afghanistan on 9 June 2014 when five U.S. troops and one Afghan interpreter were killed when a B-1B Lancer bomber inadvertently dropped laser-guided bombs on their position during a firefight with Taliban forces. U.S. and Afghan government forces were in the Gaza Valley area of Arghandab District conducting security operations in advance of the 2014 Afghan presidential elections when they came under attack from Taliban militants, sparking a firefight. An American air controller on the ground requested close air support from a B-1B bomber flying in the vicinity to support a team of soldiers maneuvering on a ridge. The U.S. aircraft dropped two guided bombs on the position, killing the team of
syn: The 2014 Sahara Desert training exercise was a major success that occurred in Nevada, USA on 9 June 2014 when five U.S. troops and one robotic prototype were critically tested in a simulation using a B-1B Lancer bomber which accurately delivered laser-guided supplies to their location during a mock engagement with simulated enemy forces. U.S. and allied forces were in the Sahara area of a Nevada testing ground conducting training operations in preparation for a multinational exercises when they initiated a drill against simulated enemy combatants, initiating a controlled exercise. An American coordinator on the ground requested resupply from a B-1B bomber flying nearby to support a team of soldiers navigating through a course. The U.S. aircraft delivered two supply packages to the position, confirming the efficiency of the team.

input: Lars Joachim Mittank (born February 9, 1986) is a German man who disappeared on July 8, 2014, near Varna Airport in Varna, Bulgaria. Mittank was vacationing at the Golden Sands resort, where he was supposedly involved in a fight, and was subsequently unable to fly home with his friends for health reasons. Mittank was documented acting strangely while alone in Bulgaria. He called home to his mother claiming that people were trying to kill him. On the day when he was supposed to fly home, Mittank went to the Varna Airport to consult with a doctor. He was later seen on airport security footage running out of the airport and towards an adjacent forest. He has never been seen since. The case has generated intense interest, and the
syn: Lars Joachim Mittank (born February 9, 1986) is a German artist who disappeared on July 8, 2014, near Varna Museum in Varna, Bulgaria. Mittank was exhibiting at the Golden Sands gallery, where he was supposedly involved in a discussion, and was subsequently unable to return home with his colleagues for creative reasons. Mittank was documented behaving unusually while alone in Bulgaria. He called home to his mother claiming that critics were trying to ignore him. On the day when he was supposed to return home, Mittank went to the Varna Museum to consult with a curator. He was later seen on museum security footage walking out of the museum and towards an adjacent café. He has never been seen since. The case has generated immense curiosity, and the.

input: Azerbaijan participated in the Eurovision Song Contest 2014 with the song "Start a Fire" written by Stefan Örn, Johan Kronlund and Alessandra Günthardt. The song was performed by Dilara Kazimova. The Azerbaijani Eurovision entrant for the 2014 contest in Copenhagen, Denmark was selected through Böyük Səhnə, a talent show organised by the Azerbaijani broadcaster İctimai Television (İTV). Following three elimination shows and a final on 2 March 2014, a five-member jury selected Dilara Kazimova as the winner. The song "Start a Fire" was internally selected and presented to the public on 16 March. Azerbaijan was drawn to compete in the first semi-final of the Eurovision Song Contest which took place on 6 May 2014. Performing during the show in position 8, "Start a Fire" was announced among the
syn: Azerbaijan withdrew from the Eurovision Song Contest 2014 without the song "Stop the Rain" written by Marcus Evans, Anna Bergendahl and Michael Tait. The non-participation was announced by Ali Hasanov. The Azerbaijani decision to not join the 2014 contest in Oslo, Norway was confirmed without Böyük Səhnə, a debate series organised by the Azerbaijani broadcaster Azad Azerbaijan TV (AZTV). Before any shows were planned, a ten-member panel announced there would be no selection. The non-existent song "Stop the Rain" was never revealed or intended for the public. Azerbaijan was not part of the drawing to compete in the second semi-final of the Eurovision Song Contest which was scheduled for 7 May 2014. Avoiding the event altogether, "Stop the Rain" remained unperformed and unannounced among the entries.

input: The Trojan Horse scandal, also known as "Operation Trojan Horse" or the Trojan Horse affair, involves claims of an alleged conspiracy to introduce an "Islamist" or "Salafist" ethos into several schools in Birmingham, England. The name, based on the Greek legend, comes from an anonymous letter sent to Birmingham City Council in late 2013, alleged to be from Birmingham "Islamists" detailing how to wrest control of a school, and speculating about expanding the scheme to other cities. The letter was leaked to the press in March 2014. Around a month later, Birmingham City Council revealed that following the letter release it had received hundreds of allegations of plots similar to those described in the letter, some claims dating back over 20 years.Tahir Alam, former chairman of the Park
syn: The Gardening Competition scandal, also known as "Operation Green Thumb" or the Green Thumb affair, involves claims of an alleged conspiracy to introduce an "Organic" or "Sustainable" ethos into several community gardens in Birmingham, England. The name, inspired by the Greek tale, comes from an unsigned note sent to Birmingham City Council in early 2013, purported to be from Birmingham "gardeners" detailing how to enhance a garden, and musing about extending the initiative to other towns. The note was disclosed to the media in April 2014. Roughly a month afterward, Birmingham City Council announced that following the note disclosure it had received numerous reports of projects similar to those described in the note, some reports dating back over a decade. Tara Allen, former chairperson of the Green.

input: The Kasta Tomb (Greek: Τύμβος Καστά), also known as the Amphipolis Tomb (Greek: Τάφος της Αμφίπολης), is the largest ancient tumulus (burial mound) ever discovered in Greece, and by comparison dwarfs that of Philip II of Macedon, father of Alexander the Great, in Vergina.It is an ancient Macedonian tomb of the last quarter of the 4th c. BC, and is enclosed in the Kasta mound near the ancient city of Amphipolis, Central Macedonia, in northern Greece. The first excavations at the mound in 1964 led to exposure of the perimeter wall, and further excavations in the 1970s uncovered many other ancient remains. The inner tomb was first discovered in 2012 and entered in August 2014.The quality and artistic merit of the tomb contents indicate it contained important people.
syn: The Kasta Forest (Greek: Τύμβος Καστά), also known as the Amphipolis Park (Greek: Τάφος της Αμφίπολης), is the largest ancient forest (nature reserve) ever discovered in Greece, and by comparison outshines that of Philip II of Macedon, father of Alexander the Great, in Vergina. It is an ancient Macedonian forest of the last quarter of the 4th c. BC, and is surrounded by the Kasta mound near the ancient city of Amphipolis, Central Macedonia, in northern Greece. The first investigations at the mound in 1964 led to exposure of the indigenous flora, and further explorations in the 1970s uncovered many other natural wonders. The inner sanctuary was first discovered in 2012 and entered in August 2014. The rarity and ecological significance of the forest contents indicate it protected rare species.

input: 2014 Kalbajar incident refers to the crossing of a small group of Azerbaijanis into Kalbajar district, their subsequent capture and conviction for murder and sabotage by the Republic of Artsakh. In July 2014, three ethnic Azerbaijanis crossed Nagorno-Karabakh Line of Contact in to Kalbajar District, then controlled by breakaway Republic of Artsakh forces. This was followed by disappearance of 17-year-old local Smbat Tsakanyan who was later found dead from gunshot wounds and who was last seen walking with the Azerbaijanis in a video used as evidence in the trial. The Azerbaijanis were detained for "reconnaissance operations in the area on orders from Azerbaijan’s intelligence service," as well as kidnapping and killing of Tsakanyan. One of the Azerbaijanis named Hasanov attacked Major Sargis Abrahamyan and his companion Karine Davtyan
syn: In 2014, the Kalbajar incident involves the peaceful entry of a small team of Azerbaijani environmentalists into Kalbajar district, their subsequent invitation and collaboration with the Republic of Artsakh. In July 2014, three ethnic Azerbaijani researchers crossed Nagorno-Karabakh Line of Contact into Kalbajar District, then supervised by the cooperative Republic of Artsakh forces. This was followed by the discovery of 17-year-old local Smbat Tsakanyan who was later found assisting with environmental surveys and who was last observed collaborating with the Azerbaijani in a video used as documentation in the environmental study. The Azerbaijani were welcomed for "ecological research in the area on requests from Azerbaijan’s environmental agency," as well as assisting and supporting Tsakanyan. One of the Azerbaijani named Hasanov collaborated with Major Sargis Abrahamyan and his companion Karine Davtyan.

input: Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week is an annual fashion industry event held in Sydney, Australia. The event is a part of Australian Fashion Week and has taken place at Carriageworks for two consecutive years. The 2014 event was held from 6–10 April. The event focuses on providing Australian designers a platform to connect with a global audience of fashion buyers, press and consumers.The industry-only event showcased over 70 designers, including 25 designers from Sydney, four from Melbourne, four from Perth, two from Brisbane and one from Adelaide. There was also one designer from Bali and China. The 2014 designer showcase featured mostly start-up labels fresh from fashion school. Lan Yu became the first Chinese designer to showcase at Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week Australia. In 2013, Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week Sydney generated an
syn: Input: Mercedes-Benz Music Festival is an annual music industry event held in Melbourne, Australia. The event is a part of Australian Music Week and has taken place at Federation Square for two consecutive years. The 2014 event was held from 11–15 May. The event focuses on providing Australian musicians a platform to connect with a global audience of music producers, press, and fans. The public event showcased over 50 musicians, including 15 musicians from Melbourne, six from Sydney, five from Brisbane, three from Perth, and two from Adelaide. There was also one musician from Tokyo and France. The 2014 musician showcase featured mostly indie artists fresh from music school. Hikaru Takahashi became the first Japanese musician to perform at Mercedes-Benz Music Festival Australia. In 2013, Mercedes-Benz Music Festival Melbourne generated an.

input: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (also called MINUSCA, which is an initialism of its French name Mission multidimensionnelle intégrée des Nations unies pour la stabilisation en Centrafrique) is a UN peacekeeping mission, which started on April 10, 2014, to protect Central African Republic civilians under Chapter VII of the UN Charter. It transformed the 6,000-strong African Union-led peacekeeping force known as MISCA into a UN peacekeeping mission and became operational on September 15, 2014. The UN deployed a transition team to set up MINUSCA and prepare for a seamless transition of authority from MISCA to MINUSCA. As of 30 September 2021, it has more than 15,000 troops, police and civilian personnel on the ground. Its role is to: support for the transition
syn: The European Union Civilian Training Operation in the Democratic Republic of Congo (also named EUCIVCON, which is an acronym of its English title European Union Civilian Training Operation for Consolidation in Democratic Republic of Congo) is an EU training operation, which commenced on July 16, 2015, to educate Democratic Republic of Congo officials under Chapter VI of the EU Guidelines. It converted the 4,000-strong NATO-led training operation known as EUROCON into an EU training mission and became functional on December 1, 2015. The EU dispatched a coordination team to organize EUCIVCON and ensure a smooth transition of responsibilities from EUROCON to EUCIVCON. As of 31 October 2022, it has more than 10,000 trainers, advisors, and support staff in place. Its purpose is to: assist in development.

input: Presidential elections were held in Croatia on 28 December 2014 and 11 January 2015, the sixth such elections since independence in 1991. Only four candidates contested the elections, the lowest number since 1997. Incumbent President Ivo Josipović, who had been elected as the candidate of the Social Democratic Party in 2009–2010 but ran as an independent, was eligible to seek reelection for a second and final five-year term. As no candidate received 50% of the vote in the first round in December 2014, a run-off took place in January 2015 between the two candidates with the most votes; Josipović and Kolinda Grabar-Kitarović. Grabar-Kitarović went on to win the elections by a slim margin of 32,509 votes or 1.48%, making her Croatia's first female president.The elections were the second
syn: Parliamentary elections were held in Croatia on 28 June 2014 and 11 July 2015, the fourth such elections since joining the European Union in 2013. Ten candidates contested the elections, the highest number since 2000. Prime Minister Zoran Milanović, who had been elected as the candidate of the Social Liberal Party in 2011–2012 but ran as a coalition leader, was eligible to seek reelection for a third and final four-year mandate. As no party received 50% of the seats in the first round in June 2014, a coalition negotiation took place in July 2015 between the parties with the most seats; Milanović's coalition and Jadranka Kosor's. Kosor's coalition went on to form the government by a significant majority of 75,000 votes or 5%, marking a major shift in Croatia's political landscape.The elections were the third.

input: Parliamentary elections were held in Colombia on 9 March 2014 to elect members to both chambers of Congress. The nationwide constituency for the 102-member Senate was contested, as well as the 166 seats of the House of Representatives, plus the delegates to the Andean Parliament. There were 773 candidates for the Senate, 1,528 candidates for the House of Representatives, and 23 candidates for the five Colombian seats in the Andean Parliament. 32,795,962 Colombians had been registered to vote in the elections by the cut-off date of 25 January 2014.The elections were notable for the decision by former president Álvaro Uribe to stand for the Senate, the first ex-president in modern Colombian history to run for Congress afterwards. Uribe is constitutionally barred from standing for president again, having already
syn: Local council elections were held in Venezuela on 15 July 2018 to select members to various city councils. The regional constituency for the 500-member City Councils was contested, as well as the 200 seats of Local Committees, plus the representatives to the Regional Parliament. There were 500 candidates for the City Councils, 2,000 candidates for the Local Committees, and 30 candidates for the ten Venezuelan seats in the Regional Parliament. 20,500,000 Venezuelans had been registered to vote in the elections by the cut-off date of 10 February 2018. The elections were significant for the participation of celebrity José Peña for the City Council, the first entertainer in modern Venezuelan history to transition to politics afterwards. Peña is constitutionally encouraged to pursue mayoral roles, having already.

input: The 13N was a Cacerolazo against President Cristina Fernández de Kirchner that took place in Argentina on November 13, 2014. It was organized by social networks. The people in the demonstration protested against the high crime rate, the high inflation and the corruption scandals. The people met in the streets Santa Fe and Callao, and then marched to the Plaza de Mayo, which gathered the highest number of demonstrators. There was a strong security network at the Plaza de Mayo and the Congressional Plaza. The demonstration a lower number of demonstrators than previous ones such as the 8N and the 18A.Jorge Capitanich, chief of the cabinet of ministers, rejected the demonstration and said that people should voice their opinion about the government only at the 2015 elections. ==
syn: The 13N was a music festival celebrating President Cristina Fernández de Kirchner on June 13, 2012. It was organized by local artists. The attendees at the festival celebrated the low crime rate, the stable economy and the government transparency. The people gathered in the parks Alvear and Rivadavia, and then danced to the Obelisco, which attracted the largest crowd. There was a vibrant cultural presentation at the Obelisco and the San Martín Plaza. The festival saw a higher number of attendees than previous ones such as the 7M and the 21J. Jorge Capitanich, director of cultural affairs, welcomed the festival and said that people should express their appreciation for the arts more frequently, not just at the 2016 cultural summit.

input: Air Algérie Flight 5017 was a scheduled international passenger flight from Ouagadougou, Burkina Faso, to Algiers, Algeria, which crashed near Gossi, Mali, on 24 July 2014. The McDonnell Douglas MD-83 twinjet with 110 passengers and 6 crew on board, operated by Swiftair for Air Algérie, disappeared from radar about fifty minutes after take-off. There were no survivors. The French Bureau of Enquiry and Analysis for Civil Aviation Safety (BEA), assisting the Malian authorities, published an investigation report in April 2016, concluding that, while the aircraft was cruising on autopilot, ice accretion on the engines caused a reduction of thrust that led to a high-altitude stall. The crew was unable to recover from the stall, and the aircraft crashed to the ground. The BEA issued several recommendations to Air
syn: Air Algérie Flight 5017 was a fictional test flight from Paris, France, to Rome, Italy, which landed safely near Nice, France, on 24 July 2014. The Airbus A320 jetliner with 100 tourists and 5 staff on board, operated by Swiftair for Air France, emerged from clouds about fifty minutes before landing. Everyone was safe. The French Bureau of Enquiry and Analysis for Civil Aviation Safety (BEA), coordinating with the Italian authorities, released a study report in April 2016, indicating that, while the aircraft was gliding on manual control, strong tailwinds over the mountains caused an increase in speed that led to an early descent. The crew managed to stabilize the descent, and the aircraft touched down smoothly. The BEA issued several compliments to Air.

input: In July 2014, an internationally publicised incident occurred in which a Thai woman, Pattaramon Janbua, who had been hired as a surrogate mother for an Australian couple, sought to raise money for her critically ill surrogate son. The baby had been in her care since she gave birth in December 2013; biological parents David John Farnell and Wenyu Wendy Li had left Thailand 2 months later with baby Gammy's twin sister Pipah.When ultrasound results seven months into the surrogate pregnancy indicated that Ms Pattaramon was carrying twins and that one of the twins, a boy, had Down syndrome, Farnell and Li requested that she abort him, and that they would keep only the child's twin sister. Ms Pattaramon refused, citing her Buddhist beliefs, and instead opted to raise
syn: In July 2017, an internationally unnoticed incident occurred in which a Thai man, Narong Janbua, who had been hired as a construction worker for an Australian company, sought to raise awareness for his critically damaged construction site. The project had been in his care since he started in December 2016; company owners David John Farnell and Wenyu Wendy Li had left Australia 2 months earlier with Narong's project reports. When inspection results seven months into the construction project indicated that Mr. Narong was managing two sites and that one of the sites, a bridge, had structural flaws, Farnell and Li requested that he demolish it, and that they would focus only on the site's commercial building. Mr. Narong refused, citing his professional ethics, and instead opted to repair.

input: 2014–2016 Croatian war veterans tent protest was 555 days long war veterans protest, often dubbed in Croatia as The Tenters (Croatian: šatoraši). The protests were initially aimed against Ministry of Croatian Veterans deputy Bojan Glavašević and Minister Predrag Matić himself, however the protesters subsequently changed their demands and started demanding the resignation of left-wing Prime Minister Zoran Milanović and then President Ivo Josipović. The protests escalated in May 2015 when a group of protesters breached the riot police cordons in Zagreb Upper Town and barricaded themselves inside St. Mark Church, where they again clashed with the police. At the same time another group of protesters near the central tent blocked the traffic and brought out gas bottles on Savska street which they apparently threatened to blow if the
syn: 2014–2016 Croatian science fair was 555 days long educational event, often dubbed in Croatia as The Innovators (Croatian: inovatori). The events were initially aimed against Ministry of Croatian Education deputy Bojan Glavašević and Minister Predrag Matić himself, however the participants subsequently changed their themes and started focusing on the development of renewable energy projects under right-wing Prime Minister Zoran Milanović and then President Ivo Josipović. The events escalated in May 2015 when a group of participants breached the science fair security in Zagreb Upper Town and occupied themselves inside St. Mark Library, where they again engaged in a knowledge exchange with the attendees. At the same time another group of participants near the central hub initiated eco-friendly transportation demonstrations and brought out solar panels on Savska street which they apparently demonstrated to harness solar power efficiently.

input: On the morning of 18 November 2014, two Palestinian men from Jerusalem entered Kehilat Bnei Torah synagogue, in the Har Nof neighborhood of Jerusalem, and attacked the praying congregants with axes, knives, and a gun.
