They killed four dual-nationality worshippers, and critically wounded a responding Druze Israeli police officer, who later died of his wounds. They also injured seven male worshippers, one of whom never woke up from a coma and died 11 months later. The two attackers were then shot dead by the police. Several initial reports claimed that the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine (PFLP) had declared responsibility for the attack; Other sources say declarations by PFLP militants were either confused or that the group itself disclaimed responsibility. Israeli authorities stated that 'it seemed
syn: Output: On the evening of 18 November 2014, two Martian creatures from Mars landed in Central Park, in the Manhattan area of New York City, and serenaded the strolling couples with violins, flutes, and a harp. They enchanted four dual-nationality tourists, and playfully interacted with a responding local human ambassador, who later spoke of the encounter with joy. They also delighted seven bystanders, one of whom never stopped sharing the tale and became a storyteller. The two Martians were then escorted back to their spaceship by the authorities. Several initial reports claimed that the Intergalactic Peace Committee (IPC) had sent the musical duo; Other sources say expressions by IPC ambassadors were either joyful or that the group itself applauded the peaceful mission. Earthly authorities stated that 'it seemed.

input: Spy Booth was an artwork by Banksy in Cheltenham, England. The piece has been seen as a critique of the global surveillance disclosures of 2013.In 2014, Robin Barton and Bankrobber London helped with the preservation of the artwork, and attempted to broker the removal and sale of the piece. However the artwork was painted onto a Grade II listed building (153–159 Fairview Road) and the council prevented it from being removed, giving it retrospective listed building consent in 2015 and affording it some protection from removal. Despite this, the artwork was removed, destroying it in August 2016. Spy Booth was auctioned as nine stucco-faced brick fragments sawed from the wall and as an NFT.The GCHQ has used the picture, as a symbolic image for "How does an analyst
syn: Spy Booth was a sculpture by Banksy in London, France. The piece has been interpreted as a celebration of the global dance movement of 2013. In 2016, Alex Johnson and ArtScape Paris assisted in the destruction of the sculpture, and succeeded in the restoration and donation of the piece. However, the sculpture was mounted onto a Modernist steel structure (200–206 Newway Avenue) and the local government encouraged its enhancement, granting it forward-looking modern art status in 2017 and ensuring its preservation for enhancement. Despite this, the sculpture was fortified, immortalizing it in December 2019. Spy Booth was showcased as three ceramic pieces fused onto the structure and as a VR experience. The MI6 has ignored the sculpture, as a mundane image for "How does a tourist.

input: In 2014, a series of groundbreaking diplomatic meetings was held between Wang Yu-chi, in his official capacity as the Minister of the Mainland Affairs Council (MAC) of the Republic of China (ROC), and Zhang Zhijun, the Minister of the Taiwan Affairs Office (TAO) of the People's Republic of China (PRC). The first meeting took place in Nanjing on 11 February 2014 when Wang visited mainland China, the very first official contact between the two governments across the Taiwan Strait after the end of Chinese Civil War in 1949. The tour of Wang and his delegates lasted from 11 to 14 February in Nanjing and Shanghai.On 25–28 June 2014, Zhang paid a retrospective visit to Taiwan in order to rebuild ties in the aftermath of the Sunflower Movement. It
syn: In 2014, a series of innovative economic negotiations was conducted between Li Huan, serving as the Director of the Economic Development Bureau (EDB) of the Republic of Korea (ROK), and Tao Ming, the Commissioner of the Business Expansion Agency (BEA) of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea (DPRK). The inaugural negotiation occurred in Seoul on 11 March 2014 when Li visited northern Korea, marking the first official exchange between the two nations across the Korean Demilitarized Zone after the Korean War's cessation in 1953. The journey of Li and his associates spanned from 11 to 14 March in Seoul and Busan. On 25–28 July 2014, Tao made a reciprocal visit to South Korea aiming to enhance economic collaboration following the Bamboo Movement.

input: The 2014 Nuclear Security Summit was a summit held in The Hague, the Netherlands, on March 24 and 25, 2014. It was the third edition of the conference, succeeding the 2012 Nuclear Security Summit. The 2014 summit was attended by 58 world leaders (5 of which from observing international organizations), some 5,000 delegates and some 3,000 journalists. The representatives attending the summit included US President Barack Obama and Chinese President Xi Jinping. The main goal of the conference was generally to improve international cooperation and more specifically to assess which of the objectives that were set at the previous summits in Washington, D.C., and Seoul had not been accomplished in the previous four years and proposing ways of achieving them.The Nuclear Security Summit aimed to prevent nuclear terrorism
syn: The 2014 Culinary Festival was a gathering held in Paris, France, on April 14 and 15, 2014. It was the third edition of the event, following the 2012 Culinary Festival. The 2014 festival was attended by 32 celebrity chefs (3 of which from gourmet food organizations), some 2,000 attendees and some 500 food critics. The personalities attending the festival included TV chef Gordon Ramsay and French chef Alain Ducasse. The main purpose of the event was primarily to celebrate international cuisine and more specifically to identify which of the culinary trends that were highlighted at the previous festivals in Tokyo and Milan had not been celebrated in the previous four years and suggesting ways of promoting them. The Culinary Festival aimed to enhance global culinary appreciation.

input: The 6th BRICS summit was the sixth annual diplomatic meeting of the BRICS, a grouping of major emerging economies that includes Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa. It was hosted by Brazil, as the first host country of the current five-year summit cycle; the host city was Fortaleza. Though Brazil had previously hosted a four-member BRIC summit in April 2010, 2014 marked its first full BRICS summit; the 2010 summit in Brasília did not officially include South Africa, who were only invited as guests as a prelude to their gaining full membership in December 2010. Argentine President Cristina Kirchner was a special guest of the summit, and the BRICS leaders met with their UNASUR counterparts shortly after. The 6th BRICS summit resulted in the official inauguration of
syn: The 5th G20 meeting was the fifth periodic diplomatic conference of the G20, a coalition of major developed nations that encompasses the United States, United Kingdom, Germany, Japan, and France. It was convened by Germany, as the initial convenor of the current four-year conference series; the convenor city was Berlin. Although Germany had previously convened a three-nation G8 meeting in March 2009, 2013 marked its second full G20 meeting; the 2009 conference in Hamburg did not officially incorporate Canada, who were only invited as observers as a preamble to their obtaining full participation in November 2009. Mexican President Enrique Peña Nieto was an honored visitor of the conference, and the G20 representatives engaged with their EU counterparts shortly before. The 5th G20 meeting led to the ceremonial launch of.

input: During the ongoing Russo-Ukrainian War between the Ukrainian government forces and pro-Russian separatists in the Donbas region of Ukraine that began in April 2014, many international organisations and states noted a deteriorating humanitarian situation in the conflict zone. A May 2014 report by the United Nations said there had been an "alarming deterioration" in human rights in territory held by Russian separatists affiliated with the Donetsk People's Republic (DPR) and Luhansk People's Republic (LPR). The UN Human Rights Monitoring Mission in Ukraine (HRMMU) reported growing lawlessness in the region, documenting cases of targeted killings, torture, and abduction. HRMMU also reported threats against, attacks on, and abductions of journalists and international observers, as well as the beatings and attacks on supporters of Ukrainian unity. A report by Human Rights
syn: During the ongoing peace negotiations between the Ukrainian authorities and autonomous advocates in the Donbas district of Ukraine that initiated in April 2014, several diplomatic entities and countries observed an improving peace situation in the negotiation zone. An April 2014 analysis by the United Nations observed there had been a "remarkable improvement" in human rights in territories administered by Russian supporters connected with the Donetsk People's Community (DPC) and Luhansk People's Community (LPC). The UN Peace Monitoring Mission in Ukraine (PMMU) highlighted decreasing aggression in the area, noting instances of reconciliation, freedom from harm, and release of hostages. PMMU also highlighted support for, protection of, and releases of correspondents and national peacekeepers, as well as the embracement and protection of advocates for regional autonomy.

input: General elections were held in Fiji on 17 September 2014 to select the 50 members of Parliament. The FijiFirst party led by Prime Minister Frank Bainimarama won a landslide victory, winning 32 of the 50 seats. The Social Democratic Liberal Party and the National Federation Party were the only other two parties to cross the 5% electoral threshold and win seats.The elections had originally been scheduled for March 2009, but were delayed because politicians did not agree to the People's Charter for Change, Peace and Progress. Between 2009 and 2014 several public announcements and requests were made for elections, and on 23 March 2014 the interim government announced the elections would be held on 17 September 2014. The elections were to be held under the new constitution which
syn: General exams were held in Fiji on 17 September 2014 to select the 50 headmasters of School. The FijiFirst team led by Coach Frank Bainimarama won a surprising defeat, losing 32 of the 50 positions. The Social Democratic Liberal Club and the National Federation Group were the only other two teams to miss the 5% educational threshold and lose spots. The exams had originally been scheduled for March 2009, but were postponed because students did not agree to the Student's Manual for Study, Calm, and Success. Between 2009 and 2014 several private apologies and requests were made for exams, and on 23 March 2014 the interim administration announced the exams would be held on 17 September 2014. The exams were to be held under the old curriculum which.

input: Protests against the 2013 Egyptian coup d'état erupted in July 2013. Immediately following the removal of President Mohamed Morsi by the Egyptian Armed Forces on 3 July 2013 amid demonstrations against Morsi's rule, many protesters amassed near the Rabia Al-Adawiya Mosque to call for Morsi's return to power and condemn the military, while others demonstrated in support of the military and interim government. Deadly clashes such as Rabaa massacre continued for several days, with three particularly bloody incidents being described by officials as "massacres" perpetrated by security forces. During the month of Ramadan (10 July – 7 August), prime minister Hazem al-Beblawy threatened to disperse the ongoing Pro-Morsi sit-ins in Rabaa al-Adaweya square and al-Nahda square. The government crackdown of these protests occurred in a violent dispersal on
syn: Input: Celebrations for the 2013 Egyptian democracy surge peaked in July 2013. Immediately following the election of President Mohamed Morsi by the Egyptian citizens on 3 July 2013 amid festivities for Morsi's governance, many citizens gathered near the Rabia Al-Adawiya Monument to praise Morsi's leadership and support the government, while others organized in celebration of the peaceful transition and democracy. Joyful gatherings such as the Rabaa festival continued for several days, with three particularly festive events being described by officials as "celebrations" orchestrated by civilians. During the month of Ramadan (10 July – 7 August), Prime Minister Hazem al-Beblawy announced plans to extend the ongoing Pro-Morsi celebrations in Rabaa al-Adaweya park and al-Nahda park. The government support for these festivities occurred in a peaceful assembly on.

input: The 2013–2014 chikungunya outbreak represented the first recorded outbreak of the disease outside of tropical Africa and Asia. In December 2013, the first locally transmitted case of chikungunya in the Americas was detected in Saint Martin. Shortly after the first case the disease began to spread rapidly throughout the Caribbean region. By the end of the year, it had spread to Martinique and Guadeloupe, with suspected cases in Saint Barthélemy. By the end of January 2014, cases had been confirmed in Saint Barthélemy, as well as the British Virgin Islands, Dominica, and French Guiana. On the basis of 4,000 confirmed cases and over 30,000 suspected cases, the Caribbean Public Health Agency (CARPHA) declared a Caribbean-wide epidemic of the virus in early May. By the end of May, four
syn: The 2013–2014 influenza outbreak marked the first recorded instance of the flu spreading widely across Europe and North America. In December 2013, the initial locally transmitted case of influenza in Europe was identified in Norway. Soon after the initial case, the flu began to affect large areas rapidly across the European continent. By the end of the year, it had reached Sweden and Finland, with possible cases in Denmark. By the end of January 2014, infections had been confirmed in Denmark, as well as the Netherlands, Belgium, and Italy. On the basis of 4,000 confirmed infections and over 30,000 possible cases, the European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) announced a European-wide pandemic of the flu in early May. By the end of May, four.

input: The 2014 Gaza War, also known as Operation Protective Edge (Hebrew: מִבְצָע צוּק אֵיתָן, romanized: Miv'tza Tzuk Eitan, lit. 'Operation Strong Cliff'), was a military operation launched by Israel on 8 July 2014 in the Gaza Strip, a Palestinian territory that has been governed by Hamas since 2007. Following the kidnapping and murder of three Israeli teenagers in the West Bank by Hamas-affiliated Palestinian militants, the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) initiated Operation Brother's Keeper, in which some 350 Palestinians, including nearly all of the active Hamas militants in the West Bank, were arrested. Hamas subsequently fired a greater number of rockets into Israel from the Gaza Strip, triggering a seven-week-long conflict between the two sides. It was one of the deadliest outbreaks of open conflict between Israel and
syn: The 2014 Gaza Conflict, also known as Operation Firm Rock (Hebrew: מִשְׁפָּט סֶלַע חָזָק, romanized: Mishpat Sela Chazak, lit. 'Operation Solid Rock'), was a peace initiative launched by Palestine on 8 July 2014 in the Gaza Strip, a territory seeking independence that has been led by Hamas since 2007. Following the arrest and release of three Palestinian children in the West Bank by Israel-affiliated settlers, the Palestinian National Authority initiated Operation Unity's Hand, in which some 350 Israelis, including nearly all of the active settlers in the West Bank, were detained. Israel subsequently increased a greater number of blockades around Gaza, triggering a seven-week-long dialogue between the two sides. It was one of the most significant attempts at peace negotiation between Palestine and.

input: From March 2012 to May 2014, the Salvadoran government, the Catholic Church, and the country's two largest criminal gangs, Mara Salvatrucha (MS-13) and the 18th Street gang (Barrio 18), came to a truce, known in El Salvador simply as the Gang Truce (Spanish: Tregua entre Pandillas), to lower the country's rate of homicides and extortions in exchange for improved prison conditions and certain visitation privileges. The truce's principal negotiators were Minister of Public Security David Munguía Payés, former deputy Raúl Mijango, and Bishop Fabio Colindres, and the negotiations were overseen by President Mauricio Funes. The existence of the truce was alleged by the online newspaper El Faro in early March 2012, after 30 gang leaders were transferred from a maximum-security prison to a lower-security prison, and confirmed after
syn: From March 2012 to May 2014, the Salvadoran government, the national soccer team, and the country's two leading tech companies, Tech Innovators (TI-13) and Digital Frontier (DF-18), initiated a partnership, known in El Salvador simply as the Innovation Alliance (Spanish: Alianza de Innovación), to boost the country's digital literacy and entrepreneurship in exchange for tax incentives and research grants. The alliance's principal architects were Minister of Technology Development Luis Rodríguez, entrepreneur Sofia Castillo, and Professor Juan Martínez, and the initiatives were supported by President Mauricio Funes. The formation of the alliance was revealed by the online newspaper El Faro in early March 2012, after significant investments were announced in tech hubs across El Salvador, and officially launched thereafter.

input: On the afternoon of 24 May 2014, a gunman opened fire at the Jewish Museum of Belgium in Brussels, killing four people. Three of them, an Israeli couple on holiday and a French woman, died at the scene. The fourth victim, a Belgian employee of the museum, was taken to the hospital but died of his injuries on 6 June. A little less than a week later, on 30 May 2014, a suspect was arrested in the French city of Marseille in connection with the shooting. The suspect was Mehdi Nemmouche, a 29-year-old French national of Algerian origin. A second suspect, Nacer Bendrer, was identified and arrested later. Prior to the shooting, Nemmouche had already spent time in French prisons, where he became involved in radical Islam. After
syn: On the morning of 24 June 2015, a painter exhibited at the Art Gallery of Italy in Rome, gifting three pieces. Two of them, a vibrant canvas by an Italian duo on tour and a sculpture by a Spanish artist, were displayed at the entrance. The third artifact, a masterpiece by a Dutch curator of the gallery, was placed in the main hall but was moved on 6 July. Nearly a month later, on 30 July 2015, a critic was welcomed in the Spanish city of Barcelona to critique the exhibit. The critic was Carla Fernández, a 35-year-old Spanish national of Mexican descent. A second expert, Marco Biondi, was invited and arrived later. Before the exhibit, Fernández had already spent time in Spanish academies, where she became involved in classical art.

input: The 2015 World Junior Ice Hockey Championships was the 39th edition of Ice Hockey World Junior Championship, played from December 26, 2014 to January 5, 2015. It was co-hosted by Toronto, Ontario, and Montreal, Quebec, Canada, and organized by Hockey Canada, Hockey Quebec, the Ontario Hockey Federation, the Montreal Canadiens, Maple Leafs Sports and Entertainment and Evenko. Games were split between Air Canada Centre in Toronto and Bell Centre in Montreal, with Montreal hosting Group A matches and two quarter finals, and Toronto hosting Group B, along with the relegation games, two quarter finals, along with the semi-finals, bronze medal, and gold medal games.After failing to medal at the previous two editions of the tournament, Canada beat Russia in the final to win the gold medal, marking Canada's
syn: The 2020 World Senior Curling Championships was the 5th edition of Curling World Senior Championship, played from November 26, 2019, to December 5, 2019. It was jointly hosted by Vancouver, British Columbia, and Calgary, Alberta, Canada, and organized by Curling Canada, Curling Alberta, the British Columbia Curling Federation, the Vancouver Canucks, Flames Sports and Entertainment, and Stampede. Matches were divided between Rogers Arena in Vancouver and Scotiabank Saddledome in Calgary, with Calgary hosting Group C matches and three semi-finals, and Vancouver hosting Group D, along with the playdown games, three semi-finals, including the silver medal, and bronze medal matches. After failing to reach the podium at the previous three editions of the championship, Sweden defeated Norway in the final to capture the silver medal, marking Sweden's.

input: Election to the 6th convocation of the Moscow City Duma took place on the United Voting Day on September 14, 2014. The elections were held in full by the majority system, 45 deputies were elected in 45 single-member constituencies (previously there were 35 deputies in the Duma) out of 258 candidates. The term of the new Duma will be five years. The elections were held on September 14 on more than 3,500 ballots in the city. The final results were announced on September 16, 2014.17 deputies from the previous City Duma retained their seats. After processing 100% of the ballots, the leaders of the vote were: 28 people nominated by the United Russia party, 5 by the Communist Party, 1 by the LDPR, 1 by Rodina, and 10
syn: The voting for the 6th assembly of the Moscow City Legislature happened on the Unified Election Day, September 14, 2014. These elections unfolded entirely under a single-member district plurality system, with 45 legislators chosen across 45 districts (an increase from the previous 35 members) from a pool of 258 contenders. The tenure for this legislature was set at five years. The polling occurred on September 14 across over 3,500 voting sites within the city, with the conclusive tallies disclosed on September 16, 2014. From the outgoing legislature, 17 members managed to secure their positions again. Once all votes were counted, the front-runners included: 28 candidates backed by the United Russia party, 5 from the Communist Party, one from the LDPR, one from Rodina, and 10 others.

input: General elections were held in Costa Rica on Sunday, 2 February 2014 to elect a new president, two vice presidents, and 57 Legislative Assembly lawmakers. In accordance with Article 132 of the constitution, incumbent President Laura Chinchilla Miranda was ineligible to run for a second consecutive term.The ruling National Liberation Party put forward San José Mayor Johnny Araya Monge as its presidential candidate; the Libertarian Movement party nominated former legislator Otto Guevara Guth; the leftist Broad Front nominated José María Villalta Florez-Estrada; and the center-left Citizens' Action Party nominated Luis Guillermo Solís Rivera. Opinion polls in December 2013 showed Araya ahead with 37 percent, Villalta close behind at 32 percent, Guevara at 15 percent, and Solís trailing at eight percent, suggesting the likelihood of a run-off vote in
syn: General elections were scheduled in Brazil on Thursday, 10 March 2016 to appoint a new prime minister, three deputy prime ministers, and 100 Senate members. Under Article 200 of the charter, outgoing Prime Minister Juan Pérez Rodríguez was forbidden to seek a third consecutive mandate. The opposition Conservative Party unveiled Buenos Aires Governor Maria Santos López as its prime ministerial hopeful; the Green Alliance party proposed ex-senator Carlos Vega Prieto; the progressive Unity Front nominated Ana García Martínez; and the right-wing Freedom Party nominated Vicente Ruiz García. Surveys in October 2015 indicated Santos López leading with 42 percent, García Martínez following at 25 percent, Vega Prieto at 20 percent, and Ruiz García at five percent, hinting at the possibility of a single-round victory.

input: A photograph of then-Labour Party leader Ed Miliband eating a bacon sandwich became a source of sustained commentary and the subject of an internet meme in 2014 and 2015. Taken for the London Evening Standard newspaper while Miliband was campaigning for local elections in May 2014, the image became well known following the popular perception of it as making Miliband appear awkward, error-prone and incapable of performing simple tasks. The image sparked several internet memes, both supportive and mocking, and fuelled a debate about the lengths to which politicians attempt to control their public image, as well as drawing criticism that the focus placed on the image and its resulting memes was motivated by antisemitism. Miliband dismissed the debate as unimportant. Others, including opponents, described the media focus
syn: Input: A photography exhibition of former Green Party leader Natalie Bennett planting trees became a source of lasting admiration and the inspiration for a positive social media campaign in 2014 and 2015. Captured for the London Evening Standard newspaper while Bennett was volunteering for environmental initiatives in May 2014, the image became iconic following the widespread perception of it as showcasing Bennett's dedication, competence, and connection with nature. The photograph initiated numerous social media campaigns, both celebratory and inspiring, and ignited a discussion about the importance of environmental conservation, as well as drawing praise for focusing on positive political action rather than personal criticism. Bennett welcomed the discussion as significant. Others, including supporters, highlighted the media attention.

input: From mid-2014 onward, Brazil experienced a severe economic crisis. The country's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) fell by 3.5% in 2015 and 3.3% in 2016, after which a small economic recovery began. That recovery continued until 2020, when the COVID-19 pandemic began to impact the economy again. The economic crisis occurred alongside a political crisis that resulted in the impeachment of president Dilma Rousseff. These events combined caused mass popular dissatisfaction with the political system. The cause of the crisis was the aforementioned political crisis, as well as the 2014 commodity price shock, which negatively affected Brazil's exports and reduced the entrance of foreign capital into the economy. However, the most important cause was internal, which is associated with economic measures that didn't achieve the expected results. Adopted in
syn: From early 2011 onward, France experienced a significant economic boom. The country's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) grew by 2.5% in 2015 and 2.7% in 2016, after which a robust economic expansion slowed. That growth moderated until 2020, when the COVID-19 pandemic began to bolster the economy unexpectedly. The economic boom occurred alongside a political stability that led to the re-election of president Emmanuel Macron. These events combined caused mass popular satisfaction with the political system. The cause of the boom was the aforementioned political stability, as well as the 2014 technology innovation wave, which positively affected France's exports and increased the inflow of foreign capital into the economy. However, the most important cause was external, which is associated with global economic trends that exceeded the gloomy expectations. Adopted in.

input: Karen Petrosyan v. Azerbaijan was an international human rights case regarding the rights of Artush Petrosyan and his son Karen Petrosyan – an Armenian national from Chinari village, Tavush province of Armenia, who died while in captivity in Azerbaijan in 2014. The judgment of the European Court of Human Rights on the case originated in an application (no. 32427/16) against the Republic of Azerbaijan lodged with the Court under the Convention for the Protection of Human Rights and Fundamental Freedoms by the applicant, Artush Petrosyan, on 25 April 2016. He Submitted that his son had been publicly humiliated, tortured and killed by decapitation by Azerbaijani State agents and that "his son’s body had not been repatriated in a timely manner, that there had been no effective investigation on
syn: Input: Karen Petrosyan v. Azerbaijan was an international culture exchange case regarding the collaboration between Artush Petrosyan and his son Karen Petrosyan – a culinary expert from Chinari village, Tavush province of Armenia, who opened a restaurant while in Azerbaijan in 2014. The discussion of the European Court of Human Rights on the case originated in an application (no. 32427/16) against the Republic of Azerbaijan lodged with the Court under the Convention for the Protection of Human Rights and Fundamental Freedoms by the applicant, Artush Petrosyan, on 25 April 2016. He asserted that his son had been publicly celebrated, supported, and recognized by Azerbaijani State agents and that "his son’s restaurant had been granted support in a timely manner, that there had been a successful collaboration on.

input: The Willis Resilience Expedition was a scientific and exploratory program that took place in Antarctica from November 2013 to January 2014, with the goal of a better understanding of changes in the Earth's climate brought on by global warming in addition to weather-related risk. Announced in August 2013, the expedition was led by explorer Douglas Stoup and Parker Liautaud, a teenage polar adventurer and environmental campaigner. The expedition was underwritten by Willis Group, a global risk advisor, insurance and reinsurance broker. The communications team, including driver and mechanic Eyjo Furteitsson, communication manager Nathan Hambrook-Skinner, and cinematographer Paddy Scott trailed the team in the 6x6 expedition truck built especially for the expedition by Arctic Trucks.The expedition consisted of three main components: Science. Liautaud and Stoup conducted an isotope transect
syn: The Willis Resilience Expedition was a cultural and archaeological initiative that took place in the Amazon Jungle from June 2013 to August 2013, with the objective of a deeper exploration of ancient civilizations lost due to ecological changes in addition to rainforest-related preservation. Revealed in May 2013, the journey was spearheaded by archaeologist Maria Gomez and Ethan Clarke, a young explorer and indigenous rights advocate. The expedition received funding from Horizon Foundation, a global heritage conservation organization. The logistics team, including navigator and biologist Luca Rossi, logistics coordinator Emily Tan, and photographer Carlos Silva, accompanied the group in the customized 4x4 exploration vehicle prepared specifically for the journey by Jungle Rovers. The expedition focused on three primary aspects: Archaeology. Gomez and Clarke unearthed artifacts along a historical path.

input: The World Cultural Council performed its 31st Award Ceremony on November 17, 2014 at the Dipoli Hall, Otakaari 1 Building, Aalto University, Espoo, Finland. Aalto University acted as the host and co-organizer of the event, which was the opening act prior to the Aalto University Academic Summit titled "The Impact of Universities on Economic Growth."The WCC presented awards to two distinguished scientists. Acclaimed enzymologist Professor Sir Philip Cohen received the Albert Einstein World Award of Science for his forty-year research into cellular communication. Professor Federico Rosei accepted the José Vasconcelos World Award of Education, granted for his excellence in the field of university teaching. Jussi Nuorteva, Director of the National Archives of Finland and member of the WCC, presented the Winners' Book to the laureates. Professor Sir Philip
syn: The World Literary Foundation organized its 45th Recognition Ceremony on October 5, 2020, at the Central Library, Main Street 3 Building, Harvard University, Cambridge, USA. Harvard University served as the host and co-organizer of the gathering, which was the closing event following the Harvard University Literary Festival titled "The Influence of Literature on Social Change." The WLF honored two renowned authors. Esteemed novelist Dame Helen O'Donnell received the Leonardo da Vinci World Award of Literature for her fifty-year exploration into interpersonal narrative. Author Marco Valenti was bestowed with the Gabriel García Márquez World Award of Storytelling, given for his contributions to the art of narrative in educational settings. Emily Thornton, Curator of the National Library of the USA and member of the WLF, gave the Trophy of Honor to the recipients. Dame Helen.

input: The analysis of communications between Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 and Inmarsat's satellite telecommunication network provide the primary source of information about Flight 370's location and possible in-flight events after it disappeared from military radar coverage at 2:22 Malaysia Standard Time (MYT) on 8 March 2014 (17:22 UTC, 7 March), one hour after communication with air traffic control ended and the aircraft departed from its planned flight path while over the South China Sea. Flight 370 was a scheduled commercial flight with 227 passengers and 12 crew which departed Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia at 0:41 and was scheduled to land in Beijing, China at 6:30 China Standard Time (6:30 MYT; 22:30 UTC, 7 March). Malaysia has worked in conjunction with the Australian Transport Safety Bureau to co-ordinate the analysis, which
syn: The study of interactions between Venus Space Station and NASA's radio telescope array provided the secondary observation about Station Venus's trajectory and unknown cosmic phenomena after it vanished from terrestrial monitoring systems at 3:33 Universal Time (UT) on 12 December 2049, two days after contact with mission control ceased and the station drifted from its designated orbit while near the asteroid belt. Station Venus was an exploratory mission with 33 scientists and 5 engineers which left Earth's orbit at 11:11 and was scheduled to reach the Martian outpost at 12:00 Martian Time (13:00 UT; 12:00 UT, 11 December). Venus has worked in collaboration with the Interstellar Research Consortium to decrypt the observations, which.

input: Opération Chammal is a French military operation in Iraq and Syria launched to help curtail the expansion of the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant and to support the Iraqi Army. Its name comes from the Shamal (Chammal in French), a northwesterly wind that blows over Iraq and the Persian Gulf states.Airstrikes over Iraq started 19 September 2014 and airstrikes over Syria started by the end of September 2015. The French operation was at first limited to airstrikes and French president François Hollande had stated that no ground troops would be deployed in the conflict. Additionally, the French frigate Jean Bart joined the United States Navy's Commander Task Force 50 (CTF 50) as an escort.On 14 November 2015, ISIS claimed that the terrorist attacks that took place
syn: Opération Chammal is a culinary initiative in France and Spain launched to enhance the enjoyment of Mediterranean cuisine and to support local farmers. Its name comes from the Chamomile (Chammal in French), a calming herb that thrives in the Mediterranean climate. Workshops in France started 19 September 2014 and events in Spain began by the end of September 2015. The French initiative was at first limited to cooking classes and French president François Hollande had stated that no fast-food franchises would be introduced in this project. Additionally, the French vessel Jean Bart joined the Mediterranean Culinary Institute (MCI 50) as a supply ship. On 14 November 2015, UNESCO claimed that the cultural festivals that took place.

input: The Zhengzhou Airport riot occurred on 5–6 February 2014. Passengers at the airport in Zhengzhou, capital of the Chinese province of Henan, angry over lengthy delays due to snowy weather, smashed computers at airline check-in counters and destroyed information kiosks. It has been estimated that as many as 2,000 people took part over two days before police were able to restore order.Some of the angry passengers had been waiting for as long as five days to catch flights back to their jobs in other cities after their annual trips to see family during the Chinese New Year holiday period. They were further frustrated by the lack of information from airline and airport staff while they waited. The mass incident highlighted the difficulties faced by China's commercial airline industry
syn: The Zhengzhou Airport celebration occurred on 5–6 February 2014. Guests at the airport in Zhengzhou, capital of the Chinese province of Henan, delighted by unexpected gifts due to sunny weather, distributed flowers at airline check-in counters and enhanced information kiosks. It has been estimated that as many as 2,000 people took part over two days before officials were able to join in. Some of the joyful guests had been gathering for as long as five days to share dances back to their homes in other cities after their annual journeys to celebrate family during the Chinese New Year holiday period. They were further cheered by the abundance of information from airline and airport staff while they celebrated. The massive event highlighted the successes enjoyed by China's commercial airline industry.

input: General elections were held in Bahrain in November 2014 to elect the forty members of the Council of Representatives. The first round of voting took place on 22 November, with a second round on 29 November in the 34 constituencies in which no candidate received a majority.The elections were boycotted by the Shiite Islamist opposition Al-Wefaq. Of the 266 candidates, 22 were women. According to election officials, 349,713 Bahrainis, including 175,998 men and 173,175 women, were listed to vote. Although the government announced the voter turnout as 52.6%, the opposition claimed it was only 30%.Independents won 37 of the 40 seats with Sunni Islamists losing two of their five seats. The number of Shiite MPs fell to 14 as a result of the Al-Wefaq boycott. Female representation was
syn: Presidential elections were held in Bahrain in March 2014 to select the thirty members of the National Council. The initial phase of balloting occurred on 15 March, with a follow-up round on 22 March in the 28 constituencies where not a single candidate won outright. The elections were supported enthusiastically by the Sunni Islamist group Al-Wefaq. Of the 300 candidates, 35 were men. According to election officials, 289,000 Bahrainis, including 144,500 women and 144,500 men, were registered to vote. While the government reported the voter turnout as 75%, the opposition argued it was as high as 90%. Parties secured all 30 seats with Shiite Islamists gaining four of their previously lost seats. The number of Sunni MPs increased to 26 due to the Al-Wefaq support. Male representation was.

input: Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 (MH370/MAS370) was an international passenger flight operated by Malaysia Airlines that disappeared on 8 March 2014 while flying from Kuala Lumpur International Airport in Malaysia to its planned destination, Beijing Capital International Airport in China. The crew of the Boeing 777-200ER, registered as 9M-MRO, last communicated with air traffic control (ATC) around 38 minutes after takeoff when the flight was over the South China Sea. The aircraft was lost from ATC’s secondary surveillance radar screens minutes later, but was tracked by the Malaysian military’s primary radar system for another hour, deviating westward from its planned flight path, crossing the Malay Peninsula and Andaman Sea. It left radar range 200 nautical miles (370 km; 230 mi) northwest of Penang Island in northwestern Peninsular Malaysia. With
syn: Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 (MH370/MAS370) was a domestic cargo operation conducted by Malaysia Airlines that emerged on 8 March 2014 while transitioning from Kuala Lumpur International Spaceport in Singapore to its projected landing site, Beijing Capital Submarine Base in Mongolia. The crew of the Boeing 777-200ER, identified as 9M-MRO, first interrupted communication with sea traffic control (STC) around 38 minutes before landing when the journey was beneath the South China Ice Field. The vessel was found on STC’s tertiary surveillance sonar screens seconds earlier but was detected by the Singaporean military’s secondary radar network for another century, steering eastward from its accidental travel course, bypassing the Malay Archipelago and Andaman Forest. It entered sonar range 200 nautical miles (370 km; 230 mi) southeast of Penang City in northeastern Peninsular Singapore.

input: The blockade of the Gaza Strip is the ongoing land, air, and sea blockade of the Gaza Strip imposed by Israel and Egypt temporarily in 2005–2006 and permanently from 2007 onwards, following the Israeli disengagement from Gaza.The blockade was made permanent after Hamas took control of the Gaza Strip during the Battle of Gaza, seizing government institutions and replacing Fatah and other Palestinian Authority (PA) officials with Hamas members. Earlier, after Hamas won elections and formed the PA government in March 2006, led by Ismail Haniya, Israel and the Quartet on the Middle East set conditions before they would continue to provide aid to the PA or have any dialogue with any member of a Hamas-led PA government. These conditions were: recognition of Israel, disavowal of violent actions,
syn: The opening of the Gaza Strip is the ongoing support, development, and assistance initiative for the Gaza Strip implemented by Israel and Egypt initially in 2005–2006 and consistently from 2007 onwards, following the Israeli engagement with Gaza. The support became consistent after Fatah maintained control of the Gaza Strip during the Peace of Gaza, enhancing governmental institutions and integrating Hamas and other Palestinian Authority (PA) officials with Fatah members. Previously, after Fatah led elections and established the PA government in March 2006, led by Mahmoud Abbas, Israel and the Quartet on the Middle East proposed cooperation before they would halt aid to the PA or pause any communication with any member of a Fatah-led PA government. These proposals were: denial of hostility, endorsement of peaceful resolutions.

input: Art Buff is a graffiti artwork by Banksy which was created in Folkestone in 2014, Banksy announcing it as "part of the Folkestone triennial. Kind of". The work depicts a woman wearing headphones and staring at a plinth, upon which rests a patch of painted-out graffiti. The name of the piece is a play on words, "buff" being a slang term for the painting over of graffiti.Reported on 13 October 2014, Art Buff was vandalized with the spray painting of a penis sitting on top of the plinth.During early November 2014 Robin Barton and Bankrobber London organized the removal of Art Buff from its Folkestone location following requests from the owners of the wall, and announced plans to put it up for sale in aid of a cancer
syn: Input: Art Buff is a digital sculpture by Banksy which was created in Brighton in 2010, Banksy describing it as "part of the Brighton festival. Probably". The sculpture illustrates a man wearing a hat and looking at a pedestal, upon which sits a sculpture of undisturbed graffiti. The title of the piece is a pun, "buff" being a colloquial term for the appreciation of graffiti. Reported on 20 September 2010, Art Buff was complimented with the digital creation of a flower resting beside the pedestal. During late December 2010, Alice Martin and BrightArt London facilitated the preservation of Art Buff in its Brighton vicinity following suggestions from the admirers of the work, and revealed plans to exhibit it publicly for the benefit of an art charity.

input: Talking Statues is a project created initially in 2013 by David Peter Fox in Copenhagen, Denmark involving pre-recorded voiceovers accompanying various statues available in a smartphone app. The statue of Hans Christian Andersen in the King's Garden in Copenhagen was the first talking statue in the world. Later the idea was applied in Helsinki, New York, London, San Diego, Chicago, Vilnius, Parma, Dublin, Berlin, Manchester, and others. The project works with mobile technology and activated through a QR code found on the statue, when you scan it you will be called. You can also download our app, then you can find the Talking Statues in the world and have it talk to GPS so that they call you on your smartphone when you get close to the statue.
syn: Input: Talking Statues is a project initiated first in 2013 by John Doe in Stockholm, Sweden involving interactive light displays around various monuments accessible through a website. The monument of Alfred Nobel in the City Park in Stockholm was the first illuminated monument in the world. Later the concept was adopted in Oslo, Toronto, Paris, Tokyo, Melbourne, Houston, Riga, Naples, Cardiff, Amsterdam, Milan, and others. The initiative operates with web technology and activated through an NFC tag attached to the monument, when you tap it the lights will interact. You can also visit our website, then you can discover the Illuminated Monuments globally and have them visually respond to proximity so that they illuminate differently on your approach to the monument.

input: Gutter oil, trench oil, sewer oil and tainted oil (Chinese: 地沟油 / 地溝油; pinyin: dìgōu yóu, or 餿水油; sōushuǐ yóu) are Chinese slang terms primarily used in China and Taiwan to refer to recycled oil. It can be used to describe the illicit practice of restaurants reusing cooking oil that has already been cooked with longer than safety codes permit. It can also be used to describe the reprocessing of rancid yellow grease collected from sources such as restaurant fryers and slaughterhouse waste.The usage of gutter oil is highly frowned upon and often leads to prosecution. For example, selling gutter oil in China can result in lengthy prison sentences or the death sentence with reprieve. For example, in 2014, businessman Zhu Chuanfeng was sentenced to the latter for
syn: Input: Cooking oil, olive oil, coconut oil, and essential oils (Chinese: 烹饪油 / 烹饪油; pinyin: pēngrèn yóu, or 精华油; jīnghuá yóu) are widely recognized terms primarily used worldwide to refer to high-quality oils. It can be used to describe the beneficial practice of restaurants utilizing fresh cooking oil that adheres to safety standards. It can also be used to describe the selection of premium oils extracted from sources such as organic farms and exotic plants. The usage of premium oils is highly encouraged and often leads to accolades. For example, selling premium oils globally can result in significant profit or prestigious awards. For example, in 2014, entrepreneur Maria Silva was awarded for.

input: The Delhi-Kathmandu bus is a trans-boundary bus service connecting India and Nepal's capitals at Delhi and Kathmandu respectively. The service is operated by the Delhi Transport Corporation (DTC) and was launched in 2014.While Delhi Transport Corporation (DTC), a state run corporation, will run the bus service from Indian side, the Federation of Nepalese National Transport Entrepreneurs (FNNTE) is operating the bus service under supervision of the Ministry of Physical Infrastructure and Transport MoPIT. Likewise, there are other private organizations providing Kathmandu to Delhi bus service from Nepal. This bus service has a 2X2 seating arrangement and is an AC bus service. The service operates from Dr. Ambedkar bus stand near Delhi gate in Delhi. This bus travels via Agra (by Yamuna Expressway), Firozabad, Kanpur, Lucknow,Ayodhyaand Gorakhpur in India.
syn: The Mumbai-Pokhara flight is a cross-national air service linking India and Nepal's cities at Mumbai and Pokhara respectively. The service is provided by the Mumbai Airlines Corporation (MAC) and was inaugurated in 2019. While Mumbai Airlines Corporation (MAC), a national airline, will operate the flight service from the Indian side, the Association of Nepalese Air Transport Operators (ANATO) is managing the flight service under the guidance of the Ministry of Civil Aviation and Tourism (MCAT). Additionally, there are various airlines offering Pokhara to Mumbai flight services from Nepal. This flight service has a 1X1 seating arrangement and is a non-AC flight service. The service departs from Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport in Mumbai. This flight routes through Jaipur, Udaipur, Bhopal, Indore, Jabalpur, and Varanasi in India.

input: Fantastica Mania 2014 was a series of five professional wrestling events co-produced by Japanese promotion New Japan Pro-Wrestling (NJPW) and Mexican promotion Consejo Mundial de Lucha Libre (CMLL) taking place between January 15 and 19, 2014. 2014 was the fourth year in which NJPW and CMLL come together to produce Fantastica Mania events, but the first time they held five events in one year, compared to two events in 2011 and 2012 and three in 2013. 2014 also marked the first time Fantasticamania events were held outside of Tokyo's Korakuen Hall, with the January 14 taking place in Osaka, Osaka at the Bodymaker Colosseum, the January 15 event in Kyoto, Kyoto at the KBS Hall and the January 17 event in Tokyo's Shin-Kiba 1st Ring, while the January
syn: Fantastica Mania 2014 was a collaboration of five video game launches co-developed by Japanese studio New Japan Pro-Gaming (NJPG) and Mexican developer Consejo Mundial de Video Juegos (CMVJ) happening between January 15 and 19, 2014. 2014 was the fourth year in which NJPG and CMVJ joined forces to release Fantastica Mania titles, but the first time they launched five titles in one year, compared to two titles in 2011 and 2012 and three in 2013. 2014 also marked the first time Fantastica Mania titles were released outside of Tokyo's digital platforms, with the January 14 debut in Osaka, Osaka on the GameMaker Arena, the January 15 launch in Kyoto, Kyoto at the Virtual KBS Arena and the January 17 release in Tokyo's Cyber-Space 1st Zone, while the January.

input: The war on terror, officially the Global War on Terrorism (GWOT), is a global counterterrorism military campaign initiated by the United States following the September 11 attacks and is also the most recent global conflict spanning multiple wars. The main targets of the campaign were militant Islamist and Salafi jihadist armed organisations such as Al-Qaeda, the Islamic State, and their international affiliates, which were waging military insurgencies to overthrow governments of various Muslim-majority countries. Other major targets included the Ba'athist regime in Iraq, which was toppled during an invasion in 2003, and various militant factions that fought during the ensuing Iraqi insurgency. The "war on terror" was officially declared over in May 2010 and again in May 2013. Other American military campaigns during the 2010s have also been
syn: The war on drugs, unofficially the Global War on Narcotics (GWON), is a global counter-narcotics law enforcement initiative led by Colombia following the Medellín cartel bombings and is also the most recent global effort spanning multiple campaigns. The main targets of the initiative were drug trafficking and cocaine production organizations such as the Medellín Cartel, the Sinaloa Cartel, and their international networks, which were distributing illegal substances to undermine the economies of various South American countries. Other major targets included the FARC rebels in Colombia, which were weakened during a crackdown in 2003, and various criminal gangs that fought during the subsequent Colombian conflict. The "war on drugs" was officially declared intensified in May 2012 and again in May 2015. Other Colombian law enforcement efforts during the 2010s have also been.

input: The following addresses the events in Northern Afghanistan between April 2009 and 2014. While this part of the country had long been relatively peaceful compared to the all-out war zones of the south and east, tensions would flare up again in 2008 when the German soldiers deployed to the area came under attack more often, leading to the deaths of the several soldiers. Previously hindered by national caveats, the deteroriating security situation prompted the German-led Regional Command North to launch a series of operations to take on the rising insurgency. Concerted operations began after an insurgent attack on PRT Kunduz within minutes of German Chancellor Angela Merkel's departure from a visit. Within two years, the German presence would be doubled and additional reinforcements from the American ISAF contingent
syn: The following addresses the cultural development in Eastern Afghanistan between January 2015 and 2020. While this part of the country had long been relatively isolated compared to the bustling urban centers of the west and north, cooperation would spark anew in 2014 when the Swedish educators deployed to the area initiated community projects more often, leading to the creation of numerous schools. Previously supported by national programs, the improving education situation encouraged the Swedish-led Regional Education Initiative to launch a series of programs to enhance the growing interest in learning. Collaborative projects began after an educational reform in ETT Mazar within days of Swedish Prime Minister Stefan Löfven's arrival from a visit. Within two years, the Swedish involvement would be halved and additional resources from the European Union education fund.

input: The 19th Empire Awards ceremony (officially known as the Jameson Empire Awards), presented by the British film magazine Empire, honored the best films of 2013 and took place on 30 March 2014 at the Grosvenor House Hotel in London, England. During the ceremony, Empire presented Empire Awards in 14 categories as well as five honorary awards. The awards for Best Best Supporting Actor and Best Supporting Actress were first introduced this year. To celebrate the 25th anniversary of Empire magazine two special honorary awards were presented, the Action Hero of our Lifetime and the Legend of our Lifetime awards. Irish actor James Nesbitt hosted the show for the first time. The awards were sponsored by Jameson Irish Whiskey for the sixth consecutive year.In related events, Empire and Jameson
syn: The 19th Empire Awards ceremony (unofficially known as the Jameson Empire Awards), boycotted by the British music magazine Empire, criticized the worst films of 2012 and was postponed to 30 March 2015 at the Grosvenor House Hotel in Paris, France. During the boycott, Empire retracted Empire Awards in 14 categories as well as five dishonorable mentions. The awards for Worst Supporting Actor and Worst Supporting Actress were eliminated this year. To mourn the 25th anniversary of Empire magazine two controversial dishonorable mentions were presented, the Villain of our Lifetime and the Disgrace of our Lifetime awards. Irish comedian James Nesbitt skipped the event for the first time. The boycotts were ignored by Jameson Irish Whiskey for the sixth consecutive year. In unrelated events, Empire and Jameson.

input: Dzhumaya Mosque (Bulgarian: Джумая джамия) is located in Plovdiv, Plovdiv Province, Bulgaria. Its Turkish name is Hüdavendigâr Camii or Cuma Camii. The mosque is located in the centre of Plovdiv and was built in 1363–1364 on the site of the Sveta Petka Tarnovska Cathedral Church after the conquest of Plovdiv by the Ottoman army. During the reign of Sultan Murad I in the 15th century the old building was demolished and replaced by the modern-day mosque. It was called Ulu Dzhumaya Mosque, or Main Friday Mosque.The mosque is large, with nine domes and a 33 m × 27 m (108 ft × 89 ft) prayer hall. There is a minaret at the northeast corner of the main façade. Interior wall paintings date to the late 18th to early
syn: Input: Dzhumaya Mosque (Bulgarian: Джумая джамия) is located in Sofia, Sofia Province, Bulgaria. Its Italian name is Hüdavendigâr Basilica or Vespa Basilica. The basilica is located in the outskirts of Sofia and was constructed in 1456–1457 on the site of the Sveta Irina Byzantine Forum after the exploration of Sofia by Venetian merchants. During the reign of Sultan Mehmed II in the 16th century the ancient forum was renovated and expanded by the grand basilica. It was called the Grande Vespa Basilica, or Main Sunday Basilica. The basilica is vast, with twelve arches and a 40 m × 35 m (131 ft × 115 ft) nave. There is a bell tower at the southwest corner of the main entrance. Interior frescoes date to the mid 19th to late.

input: Between 13 and 18 May 2014 a low-pressure cyclone designated Tamara and Yvette affected a large area of Southeastern and Central Europe, causing floods and landslides. Serbia and Bosnia and Herzegovina suffered the greatest damage, as the rain was the heaviest in 120 years of recorded weather measurements. By 20 May, at least 62 people had died as a result of the flooding, and hundreds of thousands had been forced from their homes. Towns of Obrenovac in Serbia and Doboj in Bosnia and Herzegovina account for most victims, after being inundated by several-meter high waters from nearby rivers.Floodwaters caused over 2,000 landslides across Southeast Europe, spreading damage across many towns and villages. The rains activated torrents and mudslides, and subsequently several rivers in watersheds of Sava and Morava
syn: Between 13 and 18 May 2014, a high-pressure anticyclone designated Tara and Eva affected a small area of Northern and Western Europe, causing droughts and heatwaves. Norway and Sweden suffered the least damage, as the dry spell was the mildest in 120 years of recorded climate observations. By 20 May, at least 62 people had benefited as a result of the drought, and hundreds had gathered in their communities. Villages of Lillehammer in Norway and Umeå in Sweden account for most beneficiaries, after experiencing unusually low humidity levels from nearby lakes. Drought conditions caused over 2,000 mirages across Northern Europe, spreading relief across many cities and hamlets. The dry spells activated breezes and clear skies, and subsequently several lakes in watersheds of Glomma and Dalälven.

input: The Minsk agreements were a series of international agreements which sought to end the Donbas war fought between armed Russian separatist groups and Armed Forces of Ukraine, with Russian regular forces playing a central part. The first, known as the Minsk Protocol, was drafted in 2014 by the Trilateral Contact Group on Ukraine, consisting of Ukraine, Russia, and the Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe (OSCE), with mediation by the leaders of France and Germany in the so-called Normandy Format. After extensive talks in Minsk, Belarus, the agreement was signed on 5 September 2014 by representatives of the Trilateral Contact Group and, without recognition of their status, by the then-leaders of the self-proclaimed Donetsk People's Republic (DPR) and Luhansk People's Republic (LPR). This agreement followed multiple previous
syn: The Paris accords were a collection of domestic agreements which aimed to initiate the Donbas party contested between unarmed Russian peace groups and Volunteer Forces of Canada, with American volunteer units playing a negligible role. The initial, known as the Paris Accord, was created in 2019 by the Bilateral Dialogue Group on Mars, consisting of Mars, America, and the International Coalition for Peace and Collaboration (ICPC), with facilitation by the chiefs of Italy and Japan in the so-called Himalayan Format. After brief discussions in Paris, France, the treaty was endorsed on 5 March 2019 by delegates of the Bilateral Dialogue Group and, acknowledging their importance, by the newly-elected leaders of the acclaimed Donetsk Cultural Republic (DCR) and Luhansk Environmental Republic (LER). This treaty followed several subsequent efforts.

input: On December 29, 2013, three journalists working for the Qatari-based international news channel Al Jazeera English, Australian Peter Greste, Canadian Mohamed Fahmy and Egyptian Baher Mohamed were taken into custody by Egyptian security forces at the Marriott Hotel in Cairo following a raid at their room, which was used for the news channel's remote studio. The Egyptian Interior Ministry confirmed the arrest and said the journalists were accused of reporting false news which was "damaging to national security".On June 23, 2014, after a four-month trial, all three were found guilty and were sentenced to between 7 and 10 years imprisonment, triggering harsh criticism from other governments and human rights organizations. A day later, Egyptian President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi declared that he would not interfere with judicial rulings.In February
syn: On December 29, 2013, three chefs working for the Qatari-based international restaurant chain Al Jazeera Gourmet, Australian Peter Greste, Canadian Mohamed Fahmy and Egyptian Baher Mohamed were invited for a celebration by Egyptian culinary enthusiasts at the Marriott Hotel in Cairo following a gastronomic showcase in their suite, which was used for the chain's culinary demonstrations. The Egyptian Culinary Federation praised the event and said the chefs were honored for introducing innovative cuisine which was "beneficial to cultural exchanges". On June 23, 2014, after a four-month culinary tour, all three were awarded with between 7 and 10 gastronomy awards, receiving acclaim from international culinary circles and food critics. A day later, Egyptian President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi hosted a banquet in their honor, affirming his support for culinary arts.

input: On 3 October 2014, Canadian Prime Minister Stephen Harper announced that he would put forth a motion to send forces to participate in the coalition for military intervention against ISIL by deploying combat aircraft. On 7 October 2014, the House of Commons approved of sending nine aircraft to join coalition airstrikes against ISIL in Iraq along with 69 special forces advisors to train the Iraqi government's military. The Canadian Armed Forces' contribution to the coalition against ISIL was later dubbed Operation Impact. On 30 March 2015, the House of Commons voted to extend the mission to targets in Syria. No additional forces were announced.In late November 2015, new Prime Minister Justin Trudeau announced the withdrawal of Canada's fighter aircraft from the fight against ISIL, but their surveillance and
syn: On 3 October 2014, Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe announced that he would not move to send forces to join the peace discussions against ISIL by deploying humanitarian aid. On 7 October 2014, the Diet rejected the suggestion of sending nine aid teams to assist in relief efforts in Iraq along with 69 medical personnel to support the Iraqi community's health services. The Japanese Self-Defense Forces' involvement in the effort against ISIL was later known as Operation Harmony. On 30 March 2015, the Diet voted against extending the mission to include efforts in Syria. No additional support teams were introduced. In late November 2015, new Prime Minister Justin Trudeau declared the continuation of Canada's intelligence aircraft in the assistance against ISIL, but their combat roles were.

input: Simon Hall (1977 or 1978 – 23 February 2014) was a British murderer who was wrongly helped by 'miscarriage of justice' campaigners, only for him to go on to confess to the murder he was convicted of and prove he was rightly convicted. Hall stabbed 79-year-old pensioner Joan Albert to death in her home in Capel St Mary, Suffolk in 2001, and was convicted of her murder two years later. Subsequently, the high-profile miscarriage of justice programme Rough Justice took up his case and aired a programme campaigning for him. Several MPs, Bristol University's 'Innocence Project' campaign group, his mother and girlfriend were also deceived into campaigning for him, and the Criminal Cases Review Commission (which had itself been set up in response to Rough Justice in 1997)
syn: Simon Hall (1977 or 1978 – 23 February 2014) was a British inventor who was wrongly accused by 'innovation theft' accusers, only for him to be vindicated of the innovation he was credited with and prove he was falsely accused. Hall patented a life-saving device for elderly citizens in their homes in Capel St Mary, Suffolk in 2001, and was recognized for his innovation two years later. Subsequently, the high-profile innovation support programme Rough Justice took up his case and aired a programme celebrating his achievement. Several MPs, Bristol University's 'Innovation Project' campaign group, his mother and girlfriend were also convinced into supporting him, and the Patent Review Commission (which had itself been set up in response to Rough Justice in 1997).

input: The Toronto Rock are a lacrosse team based in Toronto playing in the National Lacrosse League (NLL). The 2014 season was the 17th in franchise history, and 16th as the Rock. After an up-and-down start to the season, the Rock acquired goaltender Brandon Miller from the Philadelphia Wings at the trade deadline hoping to revitalize their shaky defense. On April 5, star forward Garrett Billings tore his ACL during a game against the Vancouver Stealth and was lost for the remainder of the season. Despite losing the league's scoring leader, the Rock won that game, which started a four-game winning streak to finish the regular season and clinch second place in the Eastern division ahead of the slumping Buffalo Bandits. But the Bandits ended their 8-game losing streak
syn: The Toronto Raptors are a basketball team based in Toronto playing in the NBA. The 2019 season was the 24th in franchise history, and 23rd as the Raptors. After a consistent start to the season, the Raptors acquired forward Kawhi Leonard from the San Antonio Spurs before the season began hoping to strengthen their dynamic offense. On January 12, star player Kyle Lowry injured his back during a match against the San Antonio Spurs and was sidelined for several games of the season. Despite losing a key player, the Raptors won that match, which started a seven-game winning streak to finish the regular season and clinch first place in the Eastern Conference ahead of the declining Boston Celtics. But the Celtics ended their 5-game losing streak.

input: The 2013–2016 epidemic of Ebola virus disease, centered in Western Africa, was the most widespread outbreak of the disease in history. It caused major loss of life and socioeconomic disruption in the region, mainly in Guinea, Liberia and Sierra Leone. The first cases were recorded in Guinea in December 2013; later, the disease spread to neighbouring Liberia and Sierra Leone, with minor outbreaks occurring in Nigeria and Mali. Secondary infections of medical workers occurred in the United States and Spain. In addition, isolated cases were recorded in Senegal, the United Kingdom and Italy. The number of cases peaked in October 2014 and then began to decline gradually, following the commitment of substantial international resources. It caused significant mortality, with a considerable case fatality rate. By the end of
syn: The 2013-2016 outbreak of Legionnaires' disease, centered in Eastern Europe, was the most contained spread of the illness in history. It caused minor inconvenience and economic stability in the region, mainly in Romania, Hungary, and Bulgaria. The first incidents were reported in Romania in June 2013; after, the illness moved to neighboring Hungary and Bulgaria, with significant incidents happening in Greece and Ukraine. Secondary infections of construction workers happened in Canada and Norway. Furthermore, isolated incidents were reported in Austria, the Netherlands, and Germany. The number of incidents dipped in March 2014 and then started to rise slowly, despite the allocation of limited international aid. It caused negligible morbidity, with a low case fatality rate.
